text: Bistro français avec une touche nord-américaine. L'atmosphère est plaisante, la carte des vins intéressante et le menu du midi approprié. Pour un lunch d'affaires ou entre amis, Holder est fiable et recommandable.
A very nice restaurant in Old Montreal. It felt like a place locals might go after work, and the food is very good. Definitely worth an evening.

The restaurant's decor is very fancy, so we initially felt underdressed in our casual clothing. However, the service was friendly and completely unpretentious. Our server offered great suggestions for food and wine pairings throughout the meal. We ordered the lobster ravioli and duck confit and paired them with the wines our server recommended. Overall a wonderful experience for a surprisingly good price!

Went here on a Monday evening, it was very busy but the service was very attentive and the food was very good. My companion had the daily fish special - it was hake and was well prepared and a very nice looking plate.   I had the hanger steak which was cooked to my liking. The salad is very good sized and very fresh greens.   Try the chocolate truffles, they were divine.

Ok, this is what I call a great bistro. The moment you step in the smells of fine wine, grilled meat and sauté vegetables coming from the kitchen invigorate you. Their bourgignon plate is fantastic and their soufflé is out of this world. Impeccable service.

We have for a starter foie gras. For main dish classic beef tartare and lamb shepherd's pie. The food was amaaaassing....  The service was excellent. The decor stylish. This is a place to return and eat the a same dishes again (and if you can to try other dishes as well).

A lot of good reviews about this restaurant and after trying twice I decided not going back.  The food is really just average. Service is definitely sub par.  The waiter usually disappears.  Calamari was ok.  Salmon tartare was average. A little under season. The yogurt sauce was not enough to make a difference. The braised beef cheek was mediocre. A bit under seasoned. Also. Short ribs could be probably better for the same cook method.  Why use beef cheeks ? potato purée was rather bland. The duck foie gras salad with poached egg was well designed with good flavor. But the greens are too little in proportion.  The chocolate cremiaux was probably the best dish among all. But there was almond bits in the ice cream that wasn't mentioned in the menu. And later they nervously denied there was any nuts.   Overall I think this restuarnt is over rated.

Steak on a Sunday! Took our reservations and upon arrival we were seated promptly. Great appetizers, and we both ordered a steak each. Unfortunately they were overcooked, and the floor manager came over and apologized profusely, agreeing with the fact and didn't charge us for the meal. Based on the fact that I had been there in previous years and always had great food and service, I'll easily go back!

Came into Montreal and open the trip with a great meal and atmosphere. The hanger streak was great with fritters and onions. The buffalo mozzarella salad with shaved parm excellent  Awesome time and the capper is the wonderful staff and service

Holder is worth going out of your way for. I returned for my second trip here and was reminded that its an excellent, albeit really large pub.   The wine list is fantastic, and they'll make you any cocktail you'd like (check out the beauty of a scotch list).   What sets this place apart is the food - I still try to recreate the endive, blue cheese and walnut oil salad I enjoyed here. Though we didn't indulge, the brunch plates coming out of the kitchen looked (and smelled) beyond words.  Staff are kind and service is quick. If you're in Old Montreal, this is a great pick for a casual yet refined dinner option.  In three words - HAVE BRUNCH HERE!
Fantastic service and great food. Beef tartare and salmon carpaccio were heavenly. Loved it!

I've only been here once, but I feel entirely comfortable saying that this is my favorite restaurant in Montreal. The food is delicious...I don't even know what a parsnip is (I assume it's some sort of vegetable), but the soup they made with it was very yummy. I also had the boeuf bourguignon with potato puree and green beans. The sauce was amazing. The whole experience was great. The food was good, the atmosphere was awesome, and the wait staff was even more wonderful--very friendly and attentive and seemed to appear as if by magic sometimes.

Dined here in the recommendation of a co-worker in Montreal.   Location was right outside Old Montreal on Rue McGill. We walked through the underground from downtown to Victoria and only had to walk 5 minutes outside in the December weather.   Atmosphere of the restaurant was nice. It was a large restaurant and tables were close but never had any hearing problems but at the time it was only half full.   My wife ordered the mussels and thought they were fantastic. I had the beef bourgagoin and also thought it was great. mine came with mashed potatoes which were great with the sauce. Hers came with fries that we both thought were great.   We thought this was the best food we had in our short Montreal and Quebec city jaunt. The two entrees plus tax and tip was $49 USD.

Fantastic food!!! The duck confit was the best I ever had!! Ever!!! Fish and chips was light and delicious!! The pineapple dessert was amazing!!! Dominic our bartender was helpful friendly and overworked!! Thank you Holder for our best meal while honeymooning in Montreal!!

The food is exceptional and the service efficient yet warm and friendly. This is great for lunch but can also be good place for a family with well-behaved kids. French specialties like "blanquette de veau" are flawlessly executed and classic north-American fares just as comforting as you would expect. This has become a staple of every trip to Montreal.

Tilapia fish dish was delish! The hanger steak is also great. I see many customers ordering mussels that come with home fries & I can't wait to try that next time. Always call for reservations, i came in today thinking tuesday wouldnt be so packed but it sure was. The atmosphere is also very inviting & classy.

Went for lunch. The decor and area is good and service was good. I got the fish and chips and they were good. My fiancé got vegetable soup and that was decent, nothing special. Overall I would say you would be happy to eat here but not totally blown away.

Stopped by Holder for valentines brunch on recommendation of a friend, I couldn't have been more happy with my experience there.  Front of the house or "Maitre D" was pure class, I was reaching for my girlfriends chair to pull it out but he beat me to it haha! Aside from the jokes this place is great, service is top notch, food was tasty with good variety of choice & decor is upscale yet inviting.   I guarantee you will leave with a solid overall experience, a must try, from brunch to supper!   P.s location is great but logo of restaurant a bit hard to see, but definitely no biggie!

An Old Montreal favorite, Holder is a beautiful French bistro that is always perfectly crowded. One of my faves is the Duck Confit with the truffle oil arugula salad. My friends are huge fans of the Steak tartar. This place is perfect for a big or small group gathering with friends. It's casual but trendy, so feel free to wear jeans with heels or your pretty little black dress.

Holder was recommended by our hotel, Place d'Armes, so I wasn't quite sure what to expect (Place D'Armes is very good hotel, btw) .  It was a Saturday brunch, and most tables by the windows were filled. We were two and the only tables even near the windows were for four.  He said that he had to ask the manager - and we were quickly ushered to the last table near the windows which was for four.  Our service was excellent.  The waiter was always nearby when needed and the busboys made sure we had water always filled.    I ordered the sundried tomato, spinach, and gruyere cheese frittata with baby arugula salad.  It was spectacular.   The Frittata was very flavorful, and the salad was beautifully dressed and actually a salad and not just a reminder of a salad.   My wife ordered the eggs benedict which comes with potatoes.  She asked to substitute the potatoes and they said no substitution but the waiter added that the potatoes were terrific and we should try them.  Well, the eggs benedict were good, and the waiter was spot on - the potatoes were fantastic - somewhat akin to scalloped potatoes, but lighter and tastier.    We complimented the manager on the way out, and he, Guiseppe Giampiccolo, gave us his card and was very friendly and asked that we call him to let him know when we would be returning.    Highly recommend Holder for Brunch, and look forward to returning to Montreal and trying for dinner.  I give it four stars for excellent Brasserie food - but for Brasserie food, it is  five star fare.

I visited Holder on a recent trip to Montreal. The service was top notch, the waiter was very friendly and accommodating, the crowd was in their mid-20s and the decor was on point. I had the Grilled Hanger Steak with Shallots and House Fries ($23). The steak was a perfect Medium Rare and the portion was adequate. I also had their Apple Cider ($6) however the portion was quite small. Overall an enjoyable experience!
Hands down my favorite restaurant in MTL! We get the steak tartare, duck confit, steak frites- it is all incredible, flavorful and cooked perfectly. Always a stop here when we visit!

We got the salmon tartare and foie-gras for appetizers, and the duck confit and beef cheeks bourgignon for dinner.  Everything was excellent.  The place is pretty loud so I recommend sitting at the bar because the tables are set higher and not as close together as the main restaurant.
The food was excellent, and so was the wine, but the absolute most memorable part of the meal was the Butterscotch Mi-Cuit!

We were staying at the trendy Place d'Armes hotel in the Vieux Port/Old Montreal and only had one night in the city. We asked the concierge for recommendations for a semi-casual French cuisine restaurant in the area (we weren't in the mood for over-the-top dining at Club Chasse et Peche, Toque, etc). She recommended Holder. Absolutely fantastic! Food was delicious, all wait staff were very attentive, and price was extremely reasonable ($120 for 2, including $40 bottle of champagne, tax & tip).   We ordered cream of asparagus soup with crab and ham (great depth of flavor), beef cheek bourguinon (amazingly flavorful and tender), duck confit on a bed of arugula with potatoes, and fish soup (the only disappointment, since it was too fishy---think anchovy taste instead of a delicate fish soup). The waiter recommended a butterscotch tart/ice cream dessert---delicious combo of hot and cold!  We will definitely return on our next trip back Montreal.

It was good. Especially food was gorgeous. But also nobody care me lol............. Maybe i was look like backpack. But it's true lol I went to here even though heavy snow. But i was really satisfy and super recommend except their service.

We stopped in for drinks and an appetizer.  The calamari was just okay - borderline rubbery.  For a bar of this size, the bourbon selection was slim.  The waitress appeared bothered by us right from the start.  While ordering, she just exuded attitude.  The icing on the cake was the bill.  She simply tossed it on the table as she walked by.  I expected better - a lot better.

Amazing food! We have never been disappointed. We usually eat lunch here but this trip decided to take our teen daughters for dinner. The pate is divine - light and not too rich. The beef cheeks Bourgogne over whipped potatoes melted in your mouth. Get a side of wild mushrooms! The girls each had steak frites and as usual it was delicious. Their wine by the glass is always the best. Go!!

My wife and I came here on a getaway weekend and felt like we were brunching with the locals.  It was busy, crowded and delicious.  We ended up taking curling with the next table over and enjoyed taking in the hues and costumes of the Montrealers the flock to this popular local favorite.

Our NYE dinner...amazing service! It seemed like a choreographed event with severs dropping in and out from our table, seamlessly. This was with 2 young children mind you. We went as a recommendation before the big party at Old Port and we were not disappointed. The food was delicious...just enough French for these Chicagoans.

Went here for lunch around peak time and got one of the last tables. Food was extremely good (even though the French onion soup was not as salty as I like). Had duck confit and fries. Lively atmosphere and friendly staff.

You had me at Hello! Il n'y a rien à dire. Tous mes soupers au Holder se sont soldés d'un vif succès.  Un bar pour les professionnels jeunes et moins jeunes, mais définitivement branchés!  Quoi de mieux que de déguster un tartare de saumon au yaourt de caviar en entrée en observant la jeune jungle urbaine parfumée et bien habillée.  Hop une bouchée de calmars frits au parmesan, accompagné d'un succulent vin blanc sec que le serveur saura vous recommander...  Assaissonner ses calmars de parmesan, une idée géniale. Merci au Holder pour toutes ces belles soirées.  Préparez-vous à payer le gros prix par contre.  Ça vaut la dépense.

Holder nous propose une cuisine variée, digne des bistros français BCBG. On y sert un tartare de boeuf tout à fait imbattable. Je n'ai pas trouvé un seul restaurant à Montréal qui ait compris comme Holder ce que signifie un tartare "bien relevé". Quand la plupart commettent un crime de lèse majesté en y ajoutant du tabasco, on est heureux de manger un tartare préparé dans la vraie tradition française.  On se régale aussi avec l'entrée de calmars qui ne baignent pas dans le gras, idem pour le fish &chips. La carte des vins est riche en choix du Nouveau monde et du Vieux continent.   Le service est symapthique et authentique, en ce sens que le personnel n'est pas blasé par le tourisme envahissant du Vieux-Port.  L'endroit est chic, très animé, un tantinet bruyant, avec une décoration cuivrée, soulignée par des miroirs style Art deco.

The past 4 years, I have gone up to Montreal for a little getaway and each time I have visited Holder. It has now become a must-visit everytime I am in Montreal. In fact, my past two trips I have been for Sunday brunch and went back at night for dinner...it is that good!  I just went this past weekend and everything is as great as I remember and each time I bring a new friend they love it just as much as me. The manager, Giusseppe is amazing. In fact, he actually remember me from my trip last year! That says quite a lot about the level of service and detail the staff put in here.  For this past trip, I tried the quiche for brunch which Giusseppe told me was a new addition to the menu. It was delicious. When I returned for dinner that night the place was packed. The staff were efficiently working their tables and service did not suffer which was quite impressive seeing how busy it was. The entire staff works as a team with the manager greeting guests and checking in on tables. I usually go with the duck confit which is incredible. Best duck confit I have ever had and it was actually my first duck dish a few years back when I first visited Holder. I wanted to try something new, so I went with the veal flank steak in a marsala sauce with frites. The veal was delicious. I 've never had veal so tender.   This place is a must try in Montreal. I have yet to have a dining experience in Montreal that has matched Holder. I can't wait to go back and visit again. Thank you Giusseppe for always a great experience!
One of my preferred local restaurants in old montreal. Try the lobster ravioli or the salmon plate well done.

We were visiting Montreal from and went to Holder for our belated Valentines day dinner on February 18/12.   We ordered a nice bottle of wine, a steak tartare appetizer, and salmon dish and a mahi mahi special for mains. The food was fresh. However, it was busy, so sometimes empty plates waited on our tables and wine glasses sat empty while our waiter was MIA... Not a deal breaker though.   However - partway through our meal a waiter that was refilling water glasses tipped a full glass over and it landed in my lap. Staff were quick to respond and give us a new table cloth/chair etc... The waiter who spilled it, of course, sincerely apologized for the accident and directed me to the washroom where they had hand dryers so I could try and dry myself off. I was not impressed that they did not offer to comp us anything for this. Even a drink, dessert or the appetizer we had already enjoyed being deducted from our bill would have been an appreciative gesture. I instead had to spend the rest of the evening with wet jeans and we were left not feeling overly impressed.  We enjoyed the food, but we would probably try another restaurant before returning to Holder again.

Pleasant service, decent cooking, nothing to be overly upset about, but nothing to be excited about either. While the pricing appears reasonable, in light of the above, Holder seems somewhat overpriced.

Excellente nourriture mais service moyen. J'ai mangé la joue de boeuf et wow!  Elle était très tendre.   Nous étions un groupe de 10 personnes et on sentait tous une pression pour nous servir rapidement.  Notre serveuse n'est jamais venue nous demander tout était ok lors du repas.   C'était l'anniversaire d'une copine et ils nous ont spécifier que le gâteau était à nos frais.  Lors que nous avions terminé de manger. Nous avions le regard de tous les employés sur nous.  Ils semblaient avoir hâte qu'on quitte.

Loooove this spot! Best brunches, coffees, eggs benedict, lunch, anything you get will likely be delicious. Service is always on point. The look/feel of this place is simply the best. Huge windows, beautiful washrooms, glasses and plates are always clean, presentation is impeccable. Bring your clients from out of town here, you won't regret it.

Nice French dining experience. We had the calf liver and duck confit. The liver was cooked well (pink, which gave it a soft texture and creamy consistency.) The accompanying mashed potatoes were okay, could've used more sauce. The duck was delicious, slightly overcooked for my liking. Fingerling potatoes were also a bit dry.  Service was great, food came out quickly.

I went there on a sunday morning for brunch, and I have to say I was amazed. Prices (at least for brunch) are reasonable, food is delicious, and the service is beyond perfection. Behind us was a large table with families, and it seemed to be a very kids-friendly place.

Definitely one of the best meals in Montreal!!  We were traveling from Toronto, with our 11-month-old baby, but we wanted to eat well.  We were reluctant to bring the baby somewhere *nice*, so we called Holder in advance to get the okay.  I should mention that it was a Monday night, so I don't know if this is always the case, but they were welcoming and gracious.  The staff were incredibly friendly, and made a point of acknowledging the baby and giving her lots of attention.  They provided a booster chair with tray for us, which was a huge plus (those are definitely way better than the wooden highchairs, which allow baby to reach the table, and clear it of any food, hot drinks, and sharp knives, haha...).    As for the meal - mmmm!!!  Hubby had the steak frites, and calamari to start.  I opted for 2 apps for my meal - shaved parmesan salad and the French Onion soup.  Both of us would HIGHLY recommend our meal.  Awesome food, welcoming atmosphere, friendly staff, great vibe.  Thank you Holder!
a classic.  Great service, wonderful food and a vast wine selection.
Recommended by a colleague and it is a winner! Good atmosphere and outstanding food! Service is friendly and attentive. Great for business dinners or a date night.
Funplace with Great food and service. Veal steak perfect! Fish lovely. Will definitely return the next time we are in Montreal.

I've tried many French restaurants in Montreal, but Holder is by far my favourite. Everything on their menu I've tried is delicious, portions are not tiny like French restaurants typically are, good wine selection, reasonable prices, and service is great. I highly recommend the salmon filet!  It's in a beautiful building and the setting inside is very nice, it's very fancy but warm and open.
My favorite restaurant in Montréal. Excellent food & service.

I really wanted to like this restaurant, but it just did not live up to expectations. The place is a large, boisterous French restaurant, which is cool. The atmosphere is upscale casual, which is great for most occasions.   The food however is where we are lacking. We started with the salmon tartare, which actually was quite tasty. It has fresh, light and well seasoned. For the main, I had the duck confit which was dry and tasteless. The skin was quite juicy. However, when you got to the meat, it was very dry and bland. The braised beef cheeks looked quite good. The portion size was large and the meat very tender. However, the flavour was still lacking. Once you got over how tender it was, you realized that it really didn't have much flavour. The tilapia was one dimensional in flavour. The lobster ravioli was actually quite tasty, but beware, the portion size is quite small.   For dessert we had the Chocolate Mousse with mocha ice cream. This is actually VERY good, but VERY dense. The coffee ice cream balances if quite well.   The service is good, but kind of rushed. We felt like they were trying to hurry us out, even though we weren't there long.    Overall the ambiance is nice, food is meh and prices are steep. I'd think twice before returning.
Tres bruyant  Bonne cuisine  Bon service

Was referred to this restaurant by our hotel - Bonaparte Auberge - and was so pleased with the results. Upon arrival Holder showcases its blend of traditional service with a fun, trendy vibe. Food was great! I had the cold Foie Gras with pears and it was smooth and rich. Dinner was beef bourgignon - and i highly recommend this dish - very tender beef and the sauce was the best i have had. My friend had steak frites which she enjoyed but even more so loved the creme brule she had for dessert. Very much worth the visit - and probably some of the best service we saw in the city.

Excellent food, welcoming hosts, and beautiful decore.  We call an hour before we go. We were lucky to find a table for 5. The place is classical, neat, and clean. The waitresses and waiters were friendly, engaging, and cheerful. Lots of smiles in this restaurant.    We ordered the tartars. The beef tartar will not disappoint you. Spicy, salted to perfection and tastes like honey on the taste buds. The Braised beef cheek à la bourguignonne is a pleasant dish. The cook knows how to add texture and sauces to compliment the beef meat. The Lobster ravioli, truffle oil beurre blanc is small size dish but you must appreciate the included ingredients to value the taste. The Grilled veal flank steak, marsala sauce, house fries is beautiful.   I strongly recommend this classy restaurant.
Really solid experience all around.   Great food and good service.   Holden gets the city's top award for salmon tartare.  And it's totally justified.

Beautiful and spacious restaurant with superb food and excellent service.  If you go there for brunch, try their goat cheese and roasted tomato omelet. One of the best I've ever tried.   Will definitely go back again

I had visited holder for the first time for brunch and I was surprisingly unimpressed. It could be a case of high expectation but I was surprised at how boring the food was.  Im a huge eggs benedict fan so I went for the eggs bene with gravlax. I think they chose the laziest way to make it - english muffin + gravlax + egg + hollandaise . I know sometimes the simple things are perfect but this wasnt the case. There was zero creative flair or interesting ingredients - that aside it was very boring and it felt like something I could have made at home.    The waiters were a bit clumsy - dropping water on the tables as they were refilling and on the phone at some point. The coffee we ordered was also meh , also spilled all underneath its serving plate.   I dont want to judge for dinner - maybe that's where they show their prowess or maybe the eggs bene with gravlax has them uninspired but I wouldn't recommend it and hope they make an effort to change it.

As close to a perfect meal as I've ever had -  My wife and I were in Montreal for vacation and found this place online.  The location was very convenient, situated near our hotel and in the middle of old Montreal just blocks from the basilica.   We went there for dinner, and bolder did not disappoint.  As a matter of fact, every element fell perfectly into place.  We arrived around 700pm Saturday night and were seated at a high top bar table.   The waiter was great.  Friendly, but not too chatty at all. Perfect. I had the braised beef cheek, which must have been some of the best beef I've ever had. She had the canard (duck) con fit. We had fois gras for an appetizer, and chocolate creme brule for desert.  All elements were literally 10/10.  Absolutely perfect.    Well done holder.  You were the best restaurant of the trip, and one of the best I've been to in my life.

Holder has a great air to the restaurant. It's very open and large but still, conceded a douillet feeling.  The menu is expansive and offers a great deal of variety. Our server was very welcoming & accommodating to our needs--my friend has a gluten allergy. The beef cheeks a la bourguignon were excellent and prepared as though I were in a hole-in-the-wall in France. Everything was seasoned in a manner that lent to flavor, without overpowering the foods. Holder's finest quality remains that their food stands alone- no theatrics were implied, just purely & sublimely prepared dishes.  I started with the tartare which was also fresh & clean. The only issue my guests and I came across were the drinks. We ordered several drinks, mostly wine. However, all the cocktails that were ordered seemed to be poorly made. The cosmo had the color and overpowering flavor of cranberry & the sidecar was too bitter-- too much citrus, perhaps. I will order beer and wine the next time I come! I typically order creme brulee when it is available. If you eat here, you must order theirs! The custard was loaded with actual vanilla bean speckles. However, it is hard to choose because all their other desserts blew our entire table away. I will visit again on my next trip to the area.

This place was recommended by a friend, who has never been but it was recommended by her friend. And for a good reason.  We almost walked right past it, because it is very classy and discrete like that. The interior was is very classical and slightly Italian-influenced. Think a good mixture of long tables for families, booths for groups of four and of course the tables of two along the windows. The lighting is very incandescent and warm, which makes everything nice and cozy.  I ordered the duck confit and my company had the steak and fries. The duck confit was the clear winner of the night. They only have a few, selected items on their menu and it's obvious that it's really all they need. Both items are well done. I highly recommend the duck confit. Trust me! We also had the pate and the salmon tartare as appetizers and the vanilla bean creme brulee for dessert. Sound delicious? They were!! I don't remember the exact prices, however it would be considered expensive to most. But I assure you: very high quality and very much worth it.   Service was great. Food took a little longer to come, but it was a busier night with lots of big parties so that was understandable. Servers were friendly but not pushy and constantly hovering. Dress code is business-casual, I would say. Do not wear a suit but do not wear a graphic tee.  It's a very versatile place. It can be intimate and romantic if you so desire or it can be wonderful for a big family gathering. Definitely a place to bring someone you need to impress. Not exactly blow their minds, but it will most certainly leave a nice memory in their mind.

Although poached eggs are on the menu, could not swap poached eggs for soft boiled even for an additional charge. No substations of ANY kind are allowed. The eggs Benedict with house cured salmon came out cold, the baby roasted potatoes were so greasy that when you forked the potato to cut it it oozed out grease, also cold. With so many places to go why bother?
Lobster ravioli and gnocchi (special) are great treats. They do beef tartar very well here. Great staff and service.

It's in my reliable places to go to when I'm debating where to bring people. Can be loud (the acoustics in this place) and some of the servers can be snotty but food is good! I like sitting out in the bar area and people like to be seen for some reason. Still I'm always happy to go:)
We ate here on our last night in Montreal.  Food was excellent.  Service was a bit slow but fairly typical for a French restaurant. A good splurge meal.

Good vibes and excellent table service. Our waiter was very attentive. The wine list is extensive and I enjoyed the French rosé. I ordered the lobster ravioli (light dish) and my partner had the hanger steak (heavier) - both great choices.

I like their food and service but i always have problem with their opening hours. We waited 30 min in front waiting for them to open as the front door board clearly says weekend brunch open from 10-15h, yet twice in a roll they ended up not open for the day. It would really be appreciated if the restaurant put up a sign at the front saying closed for the day or at least remove the large board which misled many dedicated customers into waiting in front of the restaurant.

Duck is delicious, helpful staff. Certainly a little pricey but a good value, especially for a neighborhood full of pricey tourist-trap restaurants. Holder is a bit of a splurge but worth the price. Easy to get a seat with a reservation, at least on a weeknight, crowded on weekends.

I would give this restaurant 5 stars for their food quality but there were a few hiccups. The biggest one was they ran out of a few dishes we were planning on ordering. So after going back to the menu to make a different decision my family and I were very very happy with the rest of the meal. I ordered the Lamb Shepard's Pie and it was amazing!!!! I had never had Shepard's Pie so I have nothing to compare it to but from other people who had eaten it they said it was very unique but the best they had ever eaten. The service was very good and all the food came out at the perfect time. Also, I have multiple food allergies and the waiter was very aware and was very clear on what I could and could not eat. In terms of dessert it was quite hard eating dessert at most places since I am allergic to nuts. We ended up not eating dessert here because there we're only 2 desserts I could eat but they all sounded so good. Overall this place was so good and I would definitely go back!!!!

We had a fantastic experience here on New Year's Eve. We were seated promptly which was impressive for a busy holiday evening. We both ordered specials - shelled lobster over ravioli and filet. Both dishes were beautiful and delicious. We shared profiteroles for dessert. The restaurant is beautiful inside and reminiscent of bistros in Paris. It's a touch noisy on busy evenings but it wasn't bothersome. Can't say enough about our waiter-he answered our questions and provided honest input. It was a wonderful meal!

In town only for two nights, wearing shorts and tshirts like typical American tourists but were treated just fine by the nice staff at Holders.  Visited about 7pm on a Sunday night.  Full English staff and menu.  Wife got the lobster ravioli ($21).  Portion was on the small side, but tasty.  I got the mussels and frites.  Outstanding!  Some might complain that the frites were a little on the soggy side however, I prefer them that way.  Also got the mozzarela, tomato, arugula and fig salad to split ($11).  Extensive wine and bar, but didn't order adult beverages.  I observed most other patrons either ordered the mussels as well, or got the steak and frites.   This seems to be in the business/banking district and I assume popular at lunch.  I found it far enough from the Old Montreal tourist area to weed out the other Ugly Americans like ourselves  ha ha!  For a quasi-upscale French/Canadian restaurant, this was great without breaking the bank.

Went here for lunch and the food was absolutely great! The server was very nice and honest with his suggestions. The main courses were about $20 each. The taste, presentation and first class service were top notch for such a great price.

Best duck I've ever had in my life. It was crispy on the outside and fall-off-the-bone on the inside. We were seated 15 minutes earlier than our reservation and the wait service and atmosphere were top notch!

I love Holders for the ambiance, the wonderful food - I love the high ceilngs and the feeling of the place.  Favorite time to be there: lunch; or dinner on a quiet evening (as otherwise it can get quite loud).

Really nice restaurant in old Montreal.  This is a really nice place to take a date.  The wine selection is wonderful.  For me, the beer selection is pretty weak, but that's pretty much what I find all over Montreal, so it's hard to ding the place on that.  Food was great, and I'd go back here any day.  The free wifi was nice too.

Dinner at 6pm after a long day at work. The bar was hopping but not many tables filled in the restaurant. Welcomed immediately by the maitre'd and shown to our table. Effective and unobtrusive services followed. Our meals were great, well prepared, exactly the right portion size, and were well timed.  The place filled up while we were eating.... it was chockablock two hours later when we left. Noisy and happy people, several really large tables. Looks good for families or team celebrations.  An entirely enjoyable evening.  Reservations would be a good idea.

Had dinner here yesterday.  Overall experience was "mehhh".  We made reservations and was seated right away.  Decor and ambiance was We drank a lot over the weekend so both my boyfriend and I just had water.  Upon being informed of that, the server seemed to become immediately unimpressed and snobby after (as if you MUST order a drink to be part of the club!).  We had the salmon tartare (too much yogurt/mayo), the fish soup (the best part of the meal), and we both had the duck confit with arugula and fingerling potatoes.  Entree was so-so.  Duck was good, but the arugula was kind of bland.  Couldn't taste any truffle dressing, and there were like, 4 small halves of potatoes to go with it (as if we are in a potato famine).  Overall, for the price and high expectations I had coming in here to eat, I was quite disappointed.

Dinner menu is standard fair.  The lobster ravioli was bad.  If you love ravioli and you want a hint of lobster, go for it.  If you imagine fresh juicy lobster stuff inside ravioli...  skip it.  Their brunch menu is not as robust as La Cartet just down the street but not bad.

Montreal is really an amazing food city. While my stay here was short, virtually every meal that I had here was top notch, and this one was no exception. With two friends, we ordered three entrees and a couple of things to share:  Soupe de poisson (fish soup): this is a creamy fish soup topped with chopped chives, served on the side with rouille (a breadcrumb and garlic based sauce), gruyere cheese, and a crouton. The fish stock is strong, and while the fish was pureed, the texture of the fish is still present in the soup. This was an excellent appetizer, especially as a precursor to my fish entree.  Steak tartare: the (in)famous raw beef dish loved by many. Ours came slightly spicy and garnished with a crouton and sprouts. Really, really delicious. Meat was well seasoned, and the spiciness level was perfect. Would eat an extra full portion of this if I had the time. Highly recommend anyone who haven't had the dish before to give this a try.  Pan fried monkfish: monkfish filet served mashed potatoes, grilled asparagus, and a demi-glace. Presentation was simple but elegant, and and everything paired together very nicely.  Grilled veal strip steak: steak topped with Bearnaise, and served with a mixed mushroom risotto. Again, simple presentation, but rich and delicious. Veal was cooked medium rare and remained moist, with a nice and slightly crispy exterior. Beautifully done.  Duck confit: a classic French dish made using duck legs preserved in duck fat, then served pan fried with fingerling potatoes over a bed of arugula tossed in a white truffle dressing. The dish is flavor overload, as the duck is extremely rich in flavor and virtually immersed in fat. If you like duck and strong flavors, this is the right dish for you.  We were so stuffed we did not have room for dessert. Overall, this was simply a lovely restaurant serving up French classics. Service, by the way, was excellent, and our server was both attentive and humorous, adding to this delightful experience.

Westin recommended this restaurant for lunch so we didn't hesitate to walk a mile from the hotel to try it. We were seated right away and the lady manager cheerfully told us the specials. I definitely enjoyed the duck confit and washed it down with their yummy lemon drop martini. Even the starter bread was fantastic ! Service was great for a bustling lunch hour. Highly recommended!

Went here on a Thursday  night after walking past a lot of the restaurants along the port street.  Holder was much bigger, busier, and had more life that many of the places (and was slightly recommended).  My experience was a little bit mixed.  They are obviously quite busy, so you aren't going to get the most personalized service here.  The food is solid and everyone is running around busy, and the place has a bustle about it.    I had the buffalo mozzarella and tomato salad which was excellent.  The main course, a "stew" dish was a little boring, but filling at least.  Our desserts were pretty good.  Nothing over-the-top impressive.  Wasn't blown away or anything, but its a good place to go to be around a lot of people in a big open and modern warm space.

Duck confit, where have you been my whole life!? This place was packed Saturday night but I didn't have to wait since I sat in the bar area. The wait staff was very friendly and they are accommodating to those who are gluten free. I had the duck confit which was every bit of wonderful and my boyfriend had the veal steak with Masala sauce. He wasn't too crazy for the sauce but he said the steak was cooked perfectly and very delicious. It wasn't too expensive either.

Everything about my experience here today, was 5 star.  They serve a great selection of champagne by the glass.  The foie gras starter was sublime, with the right level of sweetness from the pear compote, washed down with a smooth Sauternes.  For my main, I opted for the beef cheek bourgignon, served with perfect smooth mashed potato.  Oh, and I got engaged.  #hesaidyes  Thank you Giuseppe for your help in surprising my man.

I came here for brunch and ordered the duck confit. It could possibly be the best duck confit I have ever had. Nice and crispy, and perfectly cooked.  If I'm back in Montreal, I will definitely be coming back to have this dish again.  The restaurant is very open and has a nice ambiance. Not too loud, and also good for large groups.

Great food, excellent wine selection, and wonderful ambiance.  Our host and server were personable and detailed oriented.  They made sure our food and drinks were satisfactory.   I enjoyed the mussels (enough to share!), while my family had the beef cheeks, paperdelle pasta and hangar steak.  Everything was done to perfection.   I highly recommend Holder Restaurant and Bar, and I would definitely return to this wonderful establishment again in the future.

We went here on the recommendation of our hotel's concierge. Sometimes the concierge and recommended restaurant are running a racket. As to Holder, this place is legit, French bistro the real thing. I had the restaurant's duck, and couldn't believe how crispy the skin was yet how moist and tender the meat was. It came with a salad that was a very able complement to the duck. As others have written, the staff was very attentive. Oh, and I almost forgot... the best part. I had the lemon cream and mascarpone mousse, crumble, and coconut sherbet. All I can say is leave room for it. You might even want to have it before the main course. In the states we'd write OMG, en francais, I think mon dieu is quite appropriate.

This was our first meal on our Montreal "get a way" and it was awesome!  I had the beef cheek and it just melted in your mouth.  The service was friendly/attentive and the atmosphere was extremely comfortable.   Will be back for more!

Disappointing dinner. Pre-circus outing with my 17 year old daughter. Service was excellent, but steak frites and fish and chips were super bland. Fish tasted like the frozen kind baked in the oven. Steak was tough and tasteless. Appetizers - octopus salad and buffalo mozzarella were good. Room is very nice, but ambience is only half the battle.

So disappointed...can't review the food because we didn't stay to eat.  Booked reservations weeks ago so that we could have their French onion soup as it was rated best in Montreal. Unfortunately it's not included during brunch which did not show up on he site when I originally did my research.  We had also tried to move our reservation to an earlier time but unable to do so..the only time offered was even later...however when we arrived almost an hour earlier than our reservation the restaurant was 90% empty.  Note:  Sent a note to the restaurant because they asked for comments...in return got a rude response from the owner...might have tried to re-visit this restaurant but after this response that will never happen.  For what it's worth the French onion soup in Toronto is superior to what I experienced this weekend.

Holder Restaurant is an awesome bistro in Old Montreal. The menus come in either English or French and the server will determine by looking at you which menu to give you :p.  Our waiter was quite knowledgeable about the menu and the wine list but we balked at the expensive Burgundy and went with the Chateau de Cedres instead but the waitress gave us a pretty sour look about that.  Nonetheless, that didn't impact the quality of our food - awesome steak tartare, carpaccio, lobster ravioli and beef cheeks. Great dessert too - I had the Sucre a la creme, which is basically fudge and nuts.   I've heard it can get really noisy. I'd just say it was lively. I would definitely come back.

We ate at Holder on New Year's Eve, and really liked it.  There are a few tables near the bar, where they seated us for a drink while we waited for our "real" table, but the spot was so good, with a great "people-watching" view of the entire room, so we stayed there and had our meal too.  My GF speaks French, but I don't, and the waiter was really accommodating to both of us, despite the fact that he was so busy and the place was packed.  Very stylish crowd and good looking waitstaff... I think both me and my GF had to try to avoid starring at a few of them, ESP after a few glasses of wine.  Ok, now that its established that Holder is a scene, what else did I like?  Well, the food was great, but one goat cheese appetizer was just ok and that's where they lose a star.  Holder is not cheap, but it's way more affordable than some of the more formal French bistros.  Holder is a brasserie, which is basically one big room with a bar, so it's not tiny and intimate like a bistro, but we expected that and liked it.  Definitely a good choice for a nice meal in Montreal.

Awesome brasserie with good value. Would eat here again. Good for a first date or on a romantic weekend to Montreal without being overly soppy.  It's certainly got that 'French' feel to it and the food was very nice too...

Amazing restaurant!! The service was outstanding with servers constantly circulating ensuring the table was clean and our glasses were full. The salmon and oysters were very fresh and the creme brûlée was a huge portion, more than enough to share!

Every dish at this place was stellar! The duck confit is just phenomenal...so good, great flavor, perfectly salted, crispy skin! Foie gras dish was delightful. Beef cheek Bourgogne was passable, given the odd choice off cut? Moules frites is the best value and the frite is very crisp and dark. Service was also impeccable, fast, and friendly to non-French speakers. Just a great place all around!
Amazing food and service. Best salmon tartar in the city and wine selection is wonderful. This is one of my go to restaurants.
Lovely bistro vibe. Great food (lobster ravioli)  and friendly and efficient service.

What a wonderful restaurant! The wait staff was friendly, prompt, and knowledgeable, flawlessly transitioning between French and English for our party. All food was delicious and came out at the same time! Proportions were on the larger side, so sharing was possible on most appetizers and main dishes.   Make a reservation if you can; the dining area and bar were quite full upon arriving. Ambiance is very warm French, attire is on the dressy side.   C'est Magnifique! Highly recommend!
The place was great. The waiters were ok but the host took extra steps to check on us. Food was good and is worth the visit.

Sweet serenity! Dessert menu my God...  For the fellow foodies I don't have to even make an introduction with Holder in fine dining. This venue never has failed to please my palatte. I took a different twist this time an tried the dessert menu to share: profiteroles (3 pieces) that had a vanilla ice cream filling painted with chocolate syrup ****; a salted caramel Lava cake with a side of butterscotch icecream*****+ which was simply divine! It had a consistency of a warm muffin topped with melting  butter! I also had a side of mint tea that complimented nicely with my sweet selection.  Each dessert priced around 10$.   Always a pleasure to come back!!!

My husband and I went there for breakfast to celebrate his 30th birthday. We were a bit surprised to see the restaurant so empty for 11am on a Saturday. The service was ok, very abrupt and brisk, but still somewhat friendly. The menu at first glance was not particularly appealing... But my husband had the two soft-boiled eggs, truffle tapenade, sauteed oyster mushrooms, roasted fingerling potatoes with garlic and herbs and I had the yogurt with homemade muesli. We ordered orange juice, that came with a hair in it. My cappuccino was also tasteless as was my husband's lattee (we had gone to Le Cartet the weekend before, and had delicious coffee, so were expecting the same level at Holder). My husband's dish was delicious, and mine was just ok. The portions are actually quite small... The waiter also sat a huge group with children next to us, and considering that the restaurant was empty, we did not appreciate the lack of intimacy and respect for our personal space. Overall, the food is good, but the drinks, service and portions are nothing remarkable. We will not be going back.

Wonderful all around. Ambiance, decor service and food. Our party had the duck Confit, beef cheeks and steak dishes. All prepared nicely. Creme brulee and chocolate dessert were delish, although the chocolate was a bit small. Very crowded and recommended by locals. Would say overall nice dinner and would return.

On our first night in Montreal we stumbled across Holder and decided to give it a try .We sat at the bar and had the Spaghetti primavera and the fish and chips , both were served in a timely manner and were very good . We loved the atmosphere and had some of the friendliest and most professional service we have ever had . A nice bonus was the prices were quite reasonable for being such a higher end restaurant and being downtown. We absolutely recommend the Holder restaurant !

Nice ambience, good (not great) food.  So the biggest caveat is that in its yelp posting, it says "Good for kids: Yes."  I believe that I need to clarify that this is right only if your child is potty trained.  There is no changing table in their bathroom. The hostess was kind enough and told us to use the banquette we were sitting on to change our daughter's poopie diaper.  She was obviously being accomodating, and stated that she let people do that all the time.  I'm not sure how many customers would like to smell poop during dinner, but we had to do it anyway.  So I apologize to all of those who were there the night we ate there.  Another interesting note is that they seated those of us with kids in the back area.  Every single table in our section had a child with them. It seemed odd but somewhat understandable.  That way, the kidless could "enjoy' their meal without being interrupted, I suppose.  I ordered the braised short rib. It was ok. I probably ordered the "wrong" thing because I could have done it better myself at home. However the steak tartare was quite tasty and a good portion size!  My daughter had the salmon which was perfectly cooked and the haricot verts were al dente!  Probably won't be back but it was a good meal, but not outstanding. Thank you to the kind hostess who let us change her in the open... but this may not make your patrons happy.

Le Vieux-Montréal n'est définitivement pas qu'une immense trappe à touriste et le Holder et l'un de ces restaurants qui se démarque. Boiseries, belles verreries l'ambiance est classique mais pas dépassée. Le service est sympathique, efficace et très connaissant du menu et de la carte des vins. Le menu fortement à tendance de cuisine française offre une belle variété de plat et on nous offre aussi des plats à l'ardoise qui changent quotidiennement. La carte des dessert est aussi recherchée que délicieuse. Définitivement une adresse à ajoutée à son carnet.

Holder has great atmosphere and a great menu, fantastic service. Definitely call ahead for reservations, ideally not the same day. We called earlier on a Saturday and the earliest available was 9:30pm.  The salad with parmesan flakes is great. For cold appetizers, highly recommend the gravlax with yellow beets. For a hot appetizer, try the warm goat cheese dish, or the calamari.   The tilapia entree was perfectly cooked and well seasoned.   For dessert, the Bulgarian yogurt with honey and nuts is different but  a good choice of something new.

My wife and I were looking for a brunch place on Sunday. Nothing was open except for Holder and I can see why -- nothing can compete with this place! The service is top notch and the only thing better is the food.   I had the goat cheese and roasted tomato omelet and can't remember the last omelet I ate that even came close to this. This place has set a whole new level on what brunch should be.

Lobster ravioli for dinner. Chocolate mousse for desert. I paid for the richness of my meal the next morning but it was absolutely worth it.   The raviolis were rich.  The lobster filling the perfect amount of filling. The truffle sauce was decadent.  I think there were 7 on my plate. I offered one to my dinner mate and almost regretted it after realizing that was one less I had to enjoy. I soppped up the extra sauce with the bread.  The chocolate mousse was decadent. I could only eat half because it was so rich.   Servers were all super nice.  Gorgeous dining room.  Would definitely come back here again.

We came here for a meal with my grandparents and had a lovely time. The staff were attentive but not bothersome. They kept the water and wine glasses filled so we could enjoy our evening together. We managed to sample a good chunk of the menu between all of us and it was absolutely delightful.   It was an enjoyable evening, with great ambiance, courteous and unobtrusive service, and tasty food--everything I could ask for when taking my grandparents out in Montreal.

Had lunch here yesterday and was really impressed.  Atmosphere: Really warm and welcoming...with slight illusions of grandeur without going nuts. Essentially, my kind of place!  Food: Everything on the menu looked amazing...so I decided to order based on, what I like to call, food window shopping.  Aka...I'll have what that guy's having.  I went with the daily soup to start - a tasty carrot and sweet potato bisque, then had the grilled salmon for main. That salmon was made to perfection...one of the best I'd ever had...the word scrumptious comes to mind.  And the mashed potatoes and the citrusy butter drizzle was delish as well.  Service: We were seated promptly and out waiter was super attentive...he even took the time to explain each special in French and English - which I said wasn't necessary but he said he didn't mind since it would help me (since I can only catch every other word or so). It was a very busy lunch hour but he also took the time to come back and check on us more than I would've expected given the number of people there.  Verdict: Would definitely come back again!

Beautiful place for brunch with a French bistro feel, like Balthazar in NYC.  The servers are ethereally beautiful and the breakfast options are congruent with most brunch places.  They serve soft boiled eggs on egg cups which add a novel and nostalgic touch.  I had the Eggs Benny, which were textbook good and my boyfriend had eggs with bacon and he raved about how the bacon was wonderfully smoked.  He also had cafe au lait, which he enjoyed so much that he was contemplating ordering a few more but he had the temerity to stop himself.  All in all, it was a very nice and relaxing place to enjoy yourself and people-watch since there was a high number of very good-looking patrons while I was there.

Great atmosphere, friendly staff, hot french canadian chicks littering the joint, and most of all, great food.  I wish I had something funny to say about this place, but I was pretty buzzed.  The foie gras on gingerbread was super good though - which is all I can remember.  Would I eat here again, absolutely.

Restaurant Holder in Montreal (via www.halifood.com)  During my recent birthday weekend, spent in beautiful Montreal, I managed to have a somewhat impromptu celebratory dinner at one of the city's trendier bistros: Holder. Being one of the restaurants that I had stumbled upon during my pre-trip online research, I was excited to physically stumble upon it as well, while taking a snowy stroll through Old Montreal on the Saturday night of our long weekend. The frigid temperature and proximity of Holder to our accommodations, the W Montreal, might have also played a part in our quick decision to jump in and try Holder - that, and the fact that a customer just leaving the restaurant, who eyed us eyeing the menu, excitedly approached us to vouch for the bistro as a must-try. We were sold.  We entered Holder with cautious anticipation, it was eerily quiet on the streets of the city and it wasn't exactly tourist season, even in Montreal - we weren't sure what kind of atmosphere awaited us behind those doors. Once through the entrance, the loud bustle and conversations of an absolutely packed restaurant erupted in our ears. We walked into a full-on, middle-of-a-Saturday-night rush, in downtown Montreal - and there wasn't a seat in the house. Actually, there was ONE left... a high-top for two on the bar side that we happily accepted.   The menu was very French, which was absolutely fine because I had a desire to try salmon tartar for the first time on this trip, and Holder was one of several bistros I noticed had it on their menu in downtown Montreal. My mind was made up on that pretty quickly. To begin the meal, I chose the salad of new potatoes and marinated octopus. (Pardon the photos - all done on my trusty iPhone).  My dinner date started with Holder's take on insalata capresa, throwing in arugula and figs for good measure - a very nice addition. My potato and octopus salad featured a surprisingly nice grainy mustard vinaigrette with lots of tang; enough to balance the rich texture and flavour of the octopus, as well as the starchy potatoes.  The salmon tartar was done with yogurt and Mujjol caviar, and served with a lovely baguette crisp and micro greens. The flavour was decadent and rich, the perfect match for the crisp bread.  I love the texture of raw fish and the essence of salmon, so I also had no troubles eating it straight from my fork with no accompaniment. My date opted for a very French beef cheek bourguignon with mashed potato and mini green beans. Our server had assured him the beef cheeks were actually a Holder specialty, a dish that had been helping them to earn their reputation. I don't think a bite was left on the plate when he was done.  As you know, I'm not easily sold on dessert. To be completely truthful, I couldn't even finish my tartar, however, it was my birthday dinner and so I was talked into splitting something sweet. We ordered the chocolate mousse with coffee ice cream, and were presented with a very cute dish - the perfect size in my opinion. The mousse actually wasn't a mousse at all, and after asking our server about this he explained that there isn't quite a direct translation from english to french for the word mousse. This was more of a ganache, the texture being much more dense than a real mousse, and the flavour very decadent. The house made coffee ice cream was very nice, and the tiny chocolate-covered coffee bean on top an adorable touch. I suppose I was happy after all that we finished off the meal with a little something sweet.  Back out into the frigid streets of Old Montreal, softened by wine consumption, full bellies and the sight of that beautiful drifting white snow against the frozen cobblestone sidewalks.  (photos on www.halifood.com)

I didn't realize that not having a reservation for 3 people for dinner on Tuesday night might be a mistake - until we arrived at the restaurant to find that it was full. However, as it was still somewhat early, our host was very accommodating, and after about 10 minutes in the bar, we were taken to our table.  Good selection of beers, lots of local options. Reasonably priced wine list with good number of selections too.  We shared a few appetizers which were all very tasty and well presented - endive and watercress salad, chicken liver pâté and beef tartar.  I rarely take salmon at the restaurant, but I went for it based on our waiter's recommendation and it was outstanding, great flavor. My friend had a roasted lamb and veal special, which was delicious as well.  Selection of local cheeses made a great dessert.  Excellent service, prompt, friendly and attentive.  Highly recommended. Also make sure to have reservation, especially in the peak season.

We came for brunch when I saw salmon tartare on the menu, one of Montreal's best dishes that I have a hard time finding outside the city. It was amazing and the little dark caviar pearls made it beautiful. My side salad was perfectly dressed to balance the rich flavors of the tartare. What really pushed brunch over the top were the chef's daily housemade jams: Raspberry lime and white chocolate mango on our visit, which were the perfect palate cleansers for my main dish.

Nous sommes venus un dimanche pour un anniversaire, groupe de 20 personnes, et j'ai trouvé le menu groupe très limité et très décevant (4 choix - oeufs béné, tourtière, quiche et crêpes). Les portions étaient très petites, surtout pour le prix. Le café filtre n'est même pas inclus. J'avais encore faim après mon assiette, même en ayant mangé du pain. Le service n'était pas le plus agréable que j'ai eu. Bref, je n'y retournerai pas..

Beautiful French restaurant, dark wood, laughter, warm aromas. Our family stopped in last night. My wife had grilled salmon that was surprisingly moist. Eldest son had the hangar steak with sweet creamy caramelized onions. Youngest ate fresh salad and country style vegetable soup. I had duck confit with crispy very salty skin. For dessert we had a scrumptious caramel liquid soufflé and nice profiteroles in a tasty creme Anglaise and a fair raspberry chocolate mousse. Excellent meal.

This was my second visit to Holder, but my first review.  The temp outside was a wonderful 18 degrees as we strolled from our hotel to the restaurant only a block up the street (thank goodness).  The dining room was warm and inviting as we hung our parkas in the coat room.  There is a good variety of banket, center table and bar seating.  There are wonderful copper accents in the room and the lighting is an interesting pattern of iridescent glass and metal.   My choices from the menu were simple and rustic which fit my desire for comfort food due to the cold weather.   I started with a Grey Goose dirty martini, and my normal 3 olives...the olives were not the usual gigantor ones served locally here in NOVA, these were quite petite and as I bit into my first one off the skewer I realized it was not pitted!  I don't mind, but it helps to know ahead...and let's face it spitting those out in your hand isn't too graceful in public.  But the bartender did my drink justice...dry and oh so dirty, and the glass was full...yummm.  My starter was a vegetable soup with a great beefy tomato broth as the base, nice touch of sage in the background, salted and peppered to perfection.  The veggies were rough chopped including scallions, zucchini, chunks of tomato, petite lima beans and julienne mushrooms. The steaming bowl was topped with fresh shaved parmesean.  Main course consisted of beef cheeks (no, not the ones you sit on silly) bourguignon style.  This is classic French cooking...this method slowly simmers the beef in wine which tenderizes cuts of meat that would have been too tough to cook any other way.  The flavor of carrots, garlic and onions came shining through in the wonderful sauce that draped over the mashed potatoes like a velvet sheath.  Simply paired with the beef and mashers were haricovert....green beans folks!  I tried to figure out if the chef had actually used a burgundy, as the rich sauce could have been done with a good cabernet instead.  All in all the meal was everything I wanted that evening and since I'm headed to Montreal on a regular basis I will probably go again.  The nice thing here is that the staff instantly recognizes us Americans and quickly opts out your French menu for one in English....Merci!

this place was alright. The staff seemed alright for the most part. The food we got was ok. I had an issue with the fish being a bit rubbery, but the rest of the stuff was ok. I would go back again, but it would have to be when its quieter cause we could hardly hear each other over all the people talking so loudly

The food was tasty, the mimosa was spunky and the price wasn't hefty. That's what I call a winning recipe. I tried the egg benedict and my girlfriend had the tartare. Both were really good (even if I would have taken a fuller plate, there wasn't much there beside the potatoes). Same with the tartar, which came accompanied by one meager bread piece. The tartar itself was pretty big, which is great... If you have something to put it on. Overall great experience, fast service and great pairing.
Très très bon repas! Le servce attetionné et le ratio prix/qualité est excellent! Très belle soirée je le recommande a tous ceux qui aime la cuisine francaise!

So nice.   5 stars for service....we walked in on the busiest of nights and the host found us a table without a reservation.  5 stars for wait staff......could not have been nicer.  5 stars for wine list.......very good selection of wines by the glass and an excellent martini.  5 stars for food.....bistro fare as good as it gets.  Better confit de canard than France! and the endive salade w/ blue cheese and raisins was amazing.  All in all, a great neighborhood packed happy spot to get a delicious casual, authentic French meal with the kindest service.  :)

What a disappointment. I have been fond of this place for many years, and I made sure to bring my colleagues here when we arrived in Montreal. It was frustrating from the start. The server said we would have to hurry. She forgot the bread after several reminders. The silverware was taken for no reason. One entree was wrong, another was overcooked. Nothing was done to amend it. I was a little embarrassed. Too bad.

Pour les dîners ou soupers entre amis, l'endroit s'y prête. Mais la hauteur de plafond augmente considérablement le bruit ambiant qui peut devenir désagréable au fil des minutes surtout s'il s'agit d'un rendez vous d'affaire.   Bouffe: 3/5 Sans être très raffinés, les plats demeurent bien cuisinés. Ils sont simples et les portions suffisantes. Encore des haricots verts pas cuits!  Service: 4/5 J'ai beaucoup aimé notre serveuse. Dynamique, souriante, ayant un sens de l'humour un pince sans rire... Bref je l'ai aimée! Les serveurs de fin de soirée ont été tout aussi bon.   Décor / espace: 3/5 Le restaurant possède une ambiance de type brasserie, très convivial mais surtout très bruyant (mais moins que dans mon souvenir!). Nous ne sommes pas trop serrés mais la promiscuité est présente.   Rapport qualité / prix: 3/5 Les prix vaillent la peine pour la cuisine réalisée et la facture ressemble à une facture d'un restau du centre ville. Le choix des vins est intéressant, vins qui sont à des prix pour toutes les bourses.   Au final, un total de 13/20 qui reflète assez notre soirée. Peut-être un peu cher pour une brasserie? Oui.... Mais je l'ai pas dit fort! :).  Cela demeure une valeur sûre selon moi.

Sept 2012 - ducked into this place while walking the street and hungry.  What luck!  Nice restaurant ambiance, we sat at the window and watched people walk by....  FOOD:  Hanger Steak was incredible and it was my friend's choice but I couldn't stop eating her meal.   I had the Lobster ravioli.  It was good but so loaded with butter sauce...it is French after all but I really needed to walk off that butter after that dish!   The endive salad was also flavorful and fresh.  Highly recommend.  No CONS.  Would go back if I visit again.

Opting for a French Brassiere in Old Montreal, Holder was the perfect choice. Both charming and lively.  On a Thursday at lunch Holder caters to a corporate/business clientele and when we went, the restaurant was packed.   The menu is on the pricer side but reasonable in retrospect for the high quality cuisine.   We all enjoyed our meals (French onion soup, beef tartare,  chicken liver, beef cheeks), however, goat cheese appetizer was miniature in size and nothing special.

Came here for lunch and first off I'd like to say the service was excellent! The host and waiters were checking up on our table a few times to see if everything was ok. I really appreciated that, considering the place was quite busy. The ambiance was definitely more high end and fancy but hey, food was delicious so the restaurant definitely delivered. I had salmon tartare with caviar and fries, the portion was generous for sure. Gotta love raw food! The fries were really tasty too. It was probably an expensive lunch, but I think it was worth it.   Would recommend reserving for even brunch/lunch because when I got there (which was 11 AM on a Sunday) it was already pretty packed. Will come again one day to try their dinner menu!

We had a delicious brunch here and would definitely recommend it. My family had some of the more involved dishes, like the soft-boiled eggs with truffle tapenade and mushrooms, which was tasty. I had simple poached eggs, bacon and toast, but they were particularly high-quality eggs and bacon. The space is bright and airy, with large windows, yet still cozy. Service was friendly and professional.

We were a little weary of the front of the restaurant, which seemed a bit stuffy as it is located in the hallway of a corporate building.....we were wrong. The tablecloths were actually white paper not linen and the prices were reasonable. We ordered the mussels which were appropriately sized and were happy to have tried the creamy pastis, plus the beef cheek which FELL apart, it was so tender. The beef cheek was well balanced with sauteed pearl onions and exotic mushrooms. Try the local beer in the red varietal which had a nice spice for the winter months. You could tell locals were the majority, but the menu was english and we felt welcome.

Great restaurant located in downtown Montreal. I came to visit fora work conference and wanted to try French/Canadian cuisine. The hotel recommended this spot and I decided to give it a try.   Decor: Upon walking in the restaurant is spacious and beautiful. There is huge windows to sit by to people watch while eating. We got to see horse carriages walk by which was great!   Food: Superb! The free baguette bread is delicious and French. We had two baskets because it was so delicious. Everything everyone was ordering around us looked delicious. We ordered the chicken liver and warm goat cheese as an appetizer. Great sharing portion and very delicious. For entrees we got the Cajun tilapia which was fresh and seasoned to perfection. The steak frites was cooked well served with grilled onions and fries. My boyfriend are the entire plate!  Service: all the servers and managers were extremely nice and attentive! They had no problem translating the menu and offered great explanations!   If you are visiting I would def recommended this spot!

Can't wait to go back to Montreal so I can spend another night at Holder.  Love the place.  Was a perfect night with perfect dish after dish.  Especially loved the Salmon tartare with yogourt and Mujjol caviar, great to chase with the Lobster ravioli, beurre blanc and truffle oil.

Nous cherchions un resto ouvert le dimanche pour souper entre copine et nous n'avons pas regretté notre choix.   Très bon repas, très bon service, une soirée plus qu'agréable. Le tartare de boeuf était excellent et la crème brulée exquise. Très bon conseil sur le vin également, j'y retournerais sans hésiter.

We had an excellent dining experience at Holder. We arrived in Montreal that evening and found Holder on our short walk from location on Jun 1.  We were both tired from the flight, happy to be in this lovely city and delighted with the warm evening. We had no reservation and were seated immediately by a friendly host.  The food was excellent !  I had the confit duck on fresh greens with baby finger potatoes with that tasty duck sauce. Over the top! And a glass of wine. My wife had a bowl of soup which loved and some fried calamari. We enjoyed the meal, the service and this great location near McGill & Williams.  We will go back when we visit Montreal again.

Five stars all around!  Food: the beef cheeks were so tender! Highly recommended! The tilapia was extremely well seasoned with amazing flavor. The French Onion Soup was lighter than most, which was great for me; most French Onion Soups in this town are way too salty. The dessert that required a fifteen minute wait was decadent! The ice cream under the cookie was so unique in flavor that I wish I could bring a tub of it back home! The one Rose that they had tasted great, too, but might not have been worth that amount of money; wish the wine glasses were larger!  Service: this place might have the most efficient wait staff in all my adventures in Montreal. My water glass was was always full, there was plenty of bread, and food was ready in more than reasonable time.  Decor: the bar is stocked from ground to ceiling with wine bottles and other alcohol. Everything is placed so high up that the bartender needed a ladder.   Awesome experience! I hope to return!

We were on McGill street and starving. This place was packed, but the host was very helpful and found us a table. I've passed this place a million times but have never been inside. It was full or tourists so I was a bit worried we'd entered a tourist trap. Fortunately that couldn't be further from the truth. I order the beef cheeks and my friend the lobster ravioli. We both loved our dish. The beef cheeks are the best I've ever had. Ridiculously tender and flavorful. Next time I'm there I will be boring and order the same thing!

Great food, amazing brunch. My issue there is noise level. Service is very quick, very well located. Easy to find parking on the week-end. They fresh fruits are also very tasty and well chosen (sweet) you won't have the impression of eating fruits that don't have any taste and were picked too early, if you know what I mean...

Very brisk for Christmas lunch. I strongly recommend reservations. It is very humourous that they would turn us away when the place was empty when we walked in (see picture). But clearly a popular place and by the time we left every table in the place was full.   Without a reservation in busy Christmas lunch season I would recommend a reservation for anything more than 2 people. We sat at the bar.  Expensive lunch: $10 soup Lunch special $19 soup and pasta  Food was ok.... one of my colleagues had to send the lunch special back and the meat was raw. To their their credit they did check shortly after the first bite and were quick to bring a new plate out.  I have great respect for restaurants that have staff that can recognize a problem quickly. I think this was reflected in the tip.

Excellent food!  Started with the goat cheese appetizer. We ordered the salmon, the duck confit, and the lobster ravioli. Everyone at the table was more then satisfied. My wife and friend ordered the creme brûlée for desert and the waiter wouldn't let me off without at least trying the chocolate truffles and a cup of espresso... perfect ending to the meal.

Staff, food, atmosphere are all absolutely top class. We ordered Foie Gras, Tartare (both beef and salmon), pork steak & chips, lobster ravioli, duck and they all tasted amazing and definitely worth the price. A satisfactory experience of fine dining that would perfect your night (or day).

This was my second experience here.  The first was a Saturday night dinner in March 2012.  I can't remember much detail but it was good enough that we came back to it again a few days ago for brunch.  Canada's 18% tax on food kills me every time but I guess the slightly stronger USD cancels that out.  I say this because the brunch for three people before tip came out to $96 CAD, which seems like a lot for brunch, but we did get two desserts and cappuccinos all around so maybe not.    Price aside, the meal was excellent.  I had the duck confit and it was nice and salty as it should be.  It came with finger potatoes and arugula.  It's nearing lunchtime here and just thinking about it made my mouth water.  The vanilla creme brulee was on point.  The marzapan-type thing was good, too.  The waiters are very attentive and friendly, the place is well-lit and comfortable.  (Also while I was in the bathroom I heard the cooks yell, "Yes, chef!" in unison which I took as a good sign that they care deeply about what they serve.)  This place is in Old Montreal, which you know, has a lot of charm.  If you don't mind opening the wallet a little bit, you should eat here while in the area.

This was our introduction to Montreal and it made for a great start.   We had the french toast with caramel rum sauce, which was delicious.  The two eggs, truffle tapenade, etc meal comes with the eggs on a stand with a hole cut in the top.  I've never seen them done that way before but it was fun.

What a pleasant place.  From start to finish everything was spot on and pleasant.  The service was attentive without being over the top, the food was very good and high quality.  Great place for a family meal.

Came here on a last minute reservation and found it about 2/3 full on a weeknight.  So not exactly a hotspot, but I got the feeling it's one of a family of restaurants by the same owner.  The food was good but not inspiring. Service was fine though the waitress was a little hyper.  Okay in a pinch but there are probably better choices for food and atmosphere with a little planning.

Second visit to this place. Had the hanger steak. It was tiny. Like really tiny, maybe 3 oz. smothered onions with an overwhelming taste. Fries we warm-ish and but all broken up into little bits. Like the end of the fryer basket. No vegetables on the plate aside from the onions. Steak was tasty and cooked correctly.  I asked for ketchup for the fries and wait s at lest 10 minutes. Felt a bit like I was in paris where they are reluctant to serve fries with ketchup. My colleague had the special which was a New York strip with mashed potatoes. He said it was good but not worth the price.   Beer was good.   Don't think I'll go back. Many better places around.
Best veal chop and lobster racial we ever had. Not first time at high end restaurants. Sauce on both was amazing with truffles. Veal was very tender. If ever back inMontreal this is our 1st stop

This is my new fav brunch place in Montreal. Love the atmosphere being classy and elegant. This place is amazing as the service is also on point where they care of you and as it was my first time here, they do recommend the special and I finally decided to go with the Duck Confit Eggs Benedict.   My tea came first and then after a wait of 10-15; my food came and to my surprise, I was fascinated by the colours, flavours and presentation of that plate. The buns were perfectly moist with the eggs Benedict sauce on it as well as accompanied with a strawberry joy with it. I enjoyed it. I was so full and they have an amazing crew as well. All good things at the holder and definitely not my last time here as I'd return for sure!   I'd definitely recommend this restaurant to all if you like an amazing brunch place. It's worth it for the price as the value is what counts and it's great!   - :)

Came here on a Friday for lunch while on a business trip to Montreal. Given that it's in the financial district (Old Montreal), the crowd felt appropriately corporate. The ambiance was lively and the service was prompt and accurate.  I had the Beef Cheek, which was excellent. It was served on a bed of mashed potatoes and haricots. The sauce was a bit too savory, but didn't overpower the meat, which was so tender that I didn't even need to use my knife. Overall, my palate was pleased.  This is a good venue for business meetings and casual meals, but wouldn't be my first pick for a romantic night out.

A lovely lunch with a very nice wine list. We ordered off the quick lunch menu and had a good steak and amazing shrimp ravioli. Very flavorful. Ordered chocolate truffles for dessert and they were so rich, I couldn't finish them.

Came out the snowy cold to the most delicious moule frites (mussels and fries).  The mussels were delicious!  Be sure to ask for some bread to help soak it up.  Mmmm.  The frites were perfectly cooked, but not quite crispy enough.  Maybe cooked a little while ago?  Served with mayonaise, of course.  About $16.  I also had a nice, but small, glass of semillion-chardonay for $6.  I did not leave hungry.  I only wich I had room for creme brulee.  The restaurant is very nice with colorful, subdued lighting.  The bilingual staff was excellent and friendly.

The Yelp Reviews Did Not Disappoint Our  Expectations. As Soon As You Walk In You're Greeted and Immediately Seated. Love The Floor Plan, Atmosphere and Music Playlist.
