If You Like Red Meat, May I Recommend The Hangar Steak. The Duck Confit Is Another Favorite, The Meat Was So Tender and Delish. For Those Who Love Raw Fish,  The Salmon Tartar Is Another Must Have. Our Server Was Friendly,  Courteous and Outright Professional. Holder Resides Between The Finl District snd Old Montreal.

Food and service were rock-solid the night we were there. Serves a big menu of bistro/brasserie fare. Prices are reasonable for what you get. More importantly, the food is expertly prepared and served.  Located in a huge space with lots of tables so it was a bit on the loud side. But it seems like a great place to meet friends.

Yay! I was definitely a fan! The food was awesome here! I had to arrange dinner for a table of 20 very last minute on a Friday evening and they were able to accommodate me so thank you for doing that. It was two tables but regardless we all got there and we all had great food. I had ordered their French Onion soup to start and yes they are one of the best soup I've had in awhile. The Onion soup was soupy and the cheese all melted in my mouth. For entree, I had ordered their infamous beef cheek and that was delicious as well. At first, I wanted to get the rib eye because I haven't really had beef cheek in a long time and I forgot how tasteful it was. The server told me not to and I really should keep my order and I am glad I did. The beef cheek was cooked just right and as soon as you take a bite, it literally melts in your mouth. To end the night, I had ordered a Creme Brulee and it was pretty big for one person so if you have 2 or three people to share one creme brulee will be fine as well.

Excellent place for breakfast, has a great time even if the restaurant was full full service was great.  I can only recommend, again, breakfast is nice, variety is good and more than enough when you're hungry.  Close to old Montreal, a great walk is a must after!

I had the veal flank steak here and it is one of the best I've ever had. Got recommended to come here and it was worth it.  Food: 4/5, juicy veal with great sauce. The duck confit was very good as well.  Service: 3.5/5, a little slow but very nice stuff that is attentive  Ambience: 4/5, cool decor and very fun atmosphere for dinner.  Price: 3/5, a little pricy $30/person

Great food, amazing service. Very accommodating. They mixed up our order but very quickly fixed it and were extremely nice about it. Good champagne selection. Helpful waiters. Would recommend the salmon tartar and the lobster ravioli!

A great restaurant! I met some friends here last night and we had a wonderful meal. Not very expensive for the quality of food they're serving and totally delicious. Their boeuf bourginon is not actually a bourgignon, but rather a slow cooked beef cheek served with potatoes. That being said, it's still delicious. The service is great although the ambiance is a bit noisy.  Try the hanger steak with the chocolate cream for dessert! mmmm! :) Oh and one more thing, this place needs to get faster at giving th bill and taking payment from customers. THere have been a few times where I've seen other tables just get up and leave without paying since the bill took so long to arrive, or others where the waiters take forever to come with the payment machine.

I eat here pretty much twice a month. The tartare is very good and they have some hidden gems in the wine list. I'm always served by the same waitress, who remembers my preferences in both food and wine. It's my local joint and I always enjoy myself.

Made dinner reservations for 6:30pm on a Saturday and was warmly welcomed by a handsome, energetic fellow upon arrival.  The restaurant was fairly large, but it was rather empty for a Saturday night.  We were seated at a table for two by the window, next to an enormous pot plant that towered over our heads, literally.  I didn't mind it so much because it was on top of my fiancé's head rather than mine, plus it added a special touch to the decor, and him :)  We started off our meals with the foie gras w/ pear chutney and the endive & watercress salad, both of which were pretty tasty and fresh.  Our entrees, the braised beef cheek and duck confit, required a bit of a wait, which was confusing given that not many customers occupied the restaurant, but they were decent, just not WOW.  We both felt that the braised beef cheek, although very tender, was a bit salty and on the saucy side.  The duck was also a tad dry, a big no-no for duck confit.  Service was pretty attentive as our glasses were continuously refilled with water (It was hot out and we chugged them like we were in a desert).  The wait staff was also very friendly, shown through their smiles and cheerful demeanors.  All in all, it was a pretty good dinner but forgettable.  Nonetheless, if I was a Montreal resident, I would probably return for a meal.

My favourite meal during my Montreal stay!  We arrived at noon on Sunday - there were plenty of customers inside but the place is pretty large so we were seated immediately.   We shared 1 croissant, 1 large orange juice, crepes with berries and chocolate sauce, and a tomato/goat cheese omelette with a bagel.  All of it was delicious and tasted fresh. The chocolate sauce was decadent and the goat cheese omelette was perfectly cooked. My only complaint was the "large" OJ was small for $6. Also, the omelette came with 3 small potato wedges - wish the mini fruit cup was replaced with more of the tasty potatoes instead!  Service was excellent and efficient. The food came within 10 minutes of ordering. The manager stopped by to ask how our meal was, and as as I exited, the server who had seated me (and who was clearing a table at the time), noticed and wished me goodbye.

I LOVE THIS PLACE. Food and service was impeccable. We started with the mixed greens & warm octopus salad. Both were delicious. I needed a redemption meal consisting of moules-frites since the one I had in QC was horrible. Holder definitely more than made up for it. The white wine sauce was flavorful and worthy of bread dipping (lucked out with the last portion of the night). My bf ordered the tilapia and it was full of seasoning and accompanied with a delicious side made of veggies with pine nuts.   The staff was very attentive, but in a ninja-like fashion. Voila! All of a sudden you have a full glass of water that was just empty and a clean bowl for the 2nd half of your mussel shells. We were driving for quite some time prior to getting to Montreal and just wanted a good meal so we were in our "driving clothes" and sneakers. I don't normally go out to dine anywhere looking like this, but Holder is a classy yet unpretentious establishment so I felt comfortable enough to enjoy my delish meal. I can speak the same for their staff.   We spent about the same, if not more, on a meal during our travels to Canada and it was def worth every cent & all 5 stars.

In Old Montreal right on McGill in an office building.  Large restaurant with a very efficient staff.  Started with Mozzarella di bufala with pesto, tomatoes, arugula, figs, prosciutto, and pine nuts and balsamic vinegar. Great start.  For entrees, we had the grilled hanger steak with shallots and house fries , very good and braised beef cheek à la bourguignonne , great flavors.  For dessert, we had the profiteroles, 3 of them and vanilla crème brûlée, two very good choices.  They have a great wine list.  Truly a very enjoyable evening.

So far, I've been to this restaurant on three occasions: a brunch, a dinner and drinks with girlfriends.   For the brunch: It was a mini class reunion. The staff was very patient with us because some people were very late or never showed up. As for the food, I have to say the hot chocolate was delicious. Definitely not powder-made. The bacon was very thick and crispy. The eggs didn't get cold quickly. We got plenty of refill for coffee or tea. Great meal and at a very decent price!   For the dinner: We were 6 people but we had a reservation. Again, the staff was quite patient with us, because one person was lactose intolerant and it can take a while to get through the menu/asking the chef for no-dairy meals. I had the lobster ravioli with truffle and butter oil. Delicious but very small portion (to be expected). I was still hungry after but I stole some delicious fries from someone else. For dessert: profiteroles and ice cream. Also delicious. I can't comment on the price, because I didn't pay.   Drinks with girlfriends: On Valentine's day, 2 girlfriends and I decided to go to Holder for drinks and appetizers. We had called before to book a reservation and they told us it was not possible. When we got there, they asked us if we had a reservation. Anyway, we made it work and got a table in the bar where we could see all the couples having dinner.   Great selection of drinks at prices that are expensive. Service was efficient. The selection of appetizers was not amazing. My bill was also quite high: for two drinks and a split entrée, it was over $20.   Overall, I would go back to Holder for brunch and dinner, but maybe someplace else for drinks (mostly because of the price). But their wine selection is really good.

This place ranks highly on our list of great dining experiences for my boyfriend and I. We came here on a Sunday evening and were seated immediately next to the window. The restaurant is spacious and beautiful. The server was excellent and he was very helpful. We began our meals with two amazing appetizers. Both the foie gras with gingerbread and beef tar-tare were out of this world GOOD! It was culinary bliss and we haven't even reached our entrees yet. For the main course, we ordered the halibut (not on the menu, but was on the chalkboard) as well as the pappardelle with mushrooms. They were so delicious - it makes my mouth water just describing it.  We also had coffee at the end of our meal and the final tab was surprisingly low for what we thought we were going to pay.  Overall, Holders is a great place to enjoy what Montreal has to offer.

Stopped in for an early dinner the other day. The service was great. Very attentive, engaging, and thoughtful. She was more than willing to help us with directions to places in the area we needed to find. Not sure what the other reviewer who had an early dinner but rated the service poorly experienced but if it depended on the server explaining the dish that's a bit ridiculous as the menu has very good descriptions of the dishes so if he didn't know what he ordered, I'm not really sure what to say.  Our food was delicious. Lobster ravioli and a salmon dish over a potatoes purée. The sauces and entrees were great. Flavors were well balanced and not overdone. Will definitely go back when we are back in town.

My experience here was fantastic from top to bottom. I was thirty minutes late to my reservation because my plane got delayed. They were so kind and accommodating--even stored my suitcase for me while I dined. I was seated right away at a cute window table. Once my water glass was filled the first time, they never let it get empty and brought out breads and butter for me. I started with the warm goat cheese tart. It was the perfect balance of textures and flavors. The pastry was crisp and the goat cheese was creamy and lush and thy were paired with a basil emulsion, olive tapenade, and tomatoes which were a nice bit of acid to break up the richness. Then I had the duck confit which was sinfully delicious. The skin was crisped to absolute, melt in your mouth perfection. Not a single bite was over salted or under seasoned. It was served with a few roasted potatoes and a bed of greens (arugula I think) lightly dressed in something slightly acidic which again balanced the richness perfectly. To top off the meal, I had the butterscotch mi cuit. It was served with butterscotch ice cream and an almond twill. The mi-cuit was perfect with the bit of salt on top to balance the sweetness. The ice cream was delicious, though It may have benefitted from a hint of salt as well. There was a deep  caramel sauce on the plate as well that helped balance the sweetness of the ice cream. Everything was so well balanced and the Service was fantastic!

I am from the NYC area, so I am used to pretentious, overpriced restaurants where the consistently amazing food is served up by rushed, disgruntled, and generally unfriendly waitstaff. I expected something like this at Holder, simply because it is a fancy restaurant in a cosmopolitan city.  Coming in with that experience, I was absolutely blown away at Holder. I came with a bachelorette party of 12 and was shocked when the waitstaff told us we could easily split up our bills 12 ways. No problem. Such a request could easily get your food served with a healthy dosage of spit in a NYC restaurant. The waitstaff was so friendly. The bus boy came over to fill up our water glasses every 2 or 3 minutes. Our two waiters happily chatted with us, giving us bar recommendations for the rest of the night. Even on a fairly busy Saturday night, we never felt that they were rushed, and more importantly we did not feel rushed.  As for the food, it was not only fantastic, but very reasonably priced. I had the French Onion soup and Buffalo Mozzerella Salad. I wasn't that hungry, and I figured I would be getting an average salad - what can you really do to add to a Buffalo Mozzerella salad? Well, it was easily the best I've ever had. It was served with fantastic balsamic drizzle, really high quality olive oil, arugula, pine nuts and figs. Delicious. The French Onion Soup was crusted with a hearty serving of browned gruyere, just as it should be.  Overall I would highly recommend this place. The prices are fair, the staff is friendly, and the food is great.

Very disappointed. I went several years ago and it was good. I went last night and it was nothing close to the same experience. Our waiter was useless. He wasn't present at all. I asked for rum & coke, he brings me apple juice. Tired of waiting for him I actually get up and walk over to the back for some coke. The food was fair. Nothing special. The owners were nowhere to be seen and it showed. There appeared to be some kind of a manager lurking around. But he clearly was not concerned about the professionalism and efficiency of his staff.   I gave a 2 star review because the first time I went it was 4. But last night was a 1.   Good luck.

One of the best Duck Confit's I've ever had in my life.  There, I stamped it.   The other dish I tried here was the beef cheek, which was really tasty and rich with flavor (and fat).    Service wasn't the greatest as it was a bit pretentious (french speakers got better service) but it was passable.    Expensive food, but awesome flavor.  4 stars.

Legit. Great French cuisine.   Tried the following:  Asparagus soup with crab: so yummy, smooth, and tasty.  Foi gras: the best. Perfectly cooked. sweetness balanced with the buttery liver was delicious.  Duck confit: must try. The duck leg was cooked just right. Crispy. The salad helped balanced the duck.  Beef cheek: good but nothing exceptional. Braised beef over mashed potatoe.  I gave 4/5 due to the beef cheek. Didn't get a chance to try the beef tartar.

Great food, good service, and nice decor. I came with a friend for dinner on a Friday night. We had the salmon tartare and the warm goat cheese as appertizers. The salmon tartare was good, but not the best. The warm goat cheese was amazing! I wouldn't mind eating another plate :P I ordered duck confit as my main course, and my friend got the braised beef cheek à la bourguignonne. We both enjoyed our meals. The duck was cooked to perfection, and serve on a bed of fresh arugula. My friend's plate was very hearty. The beef was well seasoned, and the sauce was so good with bread. For dessert, I got the warm pineapple turnover which was good, but a bit too sweet for my liking. My friend got the butterscotch mi-cuit which was HEAVEN!!    We were both very satisfied with our meals. The price was very reasonable. I will definitely come back!

This has to be one of my top fav meals ever.  Started with the french onion soup.  (it's not just called onion soup in Montreal...?)  Wasn't served scalding, which is good, who wants to stare at their food in front of them for 5 minutes so they don't burn themselves?  Traditional serving with a top layer of bread below the cheese...  cheeze wasn't super stringy, broth wasn't overly salty.  Salmon tartar was amazing.  I could eat a bowlful of this.  Could have included more croustini, but bread is included with service anyway.  Lobster ravioli as the main.  So buttery and delicious, I felt guilty eating it.  My stomach was fighting a battle of being full yet still wanting more.

I spent the past weekend in Montreal on a girls' getaway weekend, hoping for only 2 things: good food and good times. Thanks in part to Holder Restaurant Bar, those wishes were granted. We stumbled upon this gem on our search for a Saturday brunch spot that could accommodate our group of 7. The menu was a nice size - a decent selection without being overwhelmed by choices, and the wait-staff was attentive. (I should also note that we had a gluten-free diner in our midst and they were very helpful in meeting her dietary needs and restrictions.) I had one of the omelets, served with choice of croissant, baguette or fresh bread and homemade preserves, a ramekin of fresh fruit and a portion of potato au gratin. The omelet was huge - fluffy and delicious, the fruit was fresh, the homemade preserves were a delight, and the potato au gratin was to die for - potatoey/cheesey/salty goodness... a fabulous way to start any day. All that plus coffee and tip came to under $20. The entire group (that's 7/7) was SO impressed with the quality and value of the food, and we all hope to be back sometime soon.

my buddy and i came here for dinner recently since it was close by to our conference hotel..   we were seated promptly despite not having reservations and it was relatively packed house..   service was prompt and friendly.. my buddy got the duck confit and i got the beef cheek bourguignon.. the execution was spot.. the duck confit was crispy, ducky and beautifully prepared... my beef cheek bourguignon was phenomenal.. really a simple dish.. but the beef was ridiculously tender.. the braise was rich and hearty..   all this was washed down with beer..   if i'm back in montreal.. i'd definitely head back here.. it seems like it was packed with locals

Everyone at my table absolutely loved their meal at Holder! We started with the amazing warm goat cheese and delicious mussels (an entree that we chose to get as an appetizer). I had the braised beef cheek was very flavorful and so tender. Also, the lamb shepherd's pie was very noteworthy as well--the lamb was pulled not ground which I thought was a wonderful choice. I would definitely come back again!

I have been a few times  I have to say that it's once of the best service in the city  Very attentive staff  I had the oysters , they were succulent !  I also had the salmon tartar which is on the best I ever had. They mix it with yogurt and caviar which makes it heavenly.  I had the steak which was pretty good  My favorite desert is the mi-cuit! Wow!
Excellent food, a little pricey but amazing.

Nous sommes arrives là par hasard, ne sachant pas vraiment où manger. Un très beau restaurant, la décoration est vraiment chouette avec les bouteilles de vin au mur. Le menu du brunch est alléchant et c'est difficile de choisir. Pour ma part, j'y ai été avec le tartare de saumon. Le goût est là et la portion est généreuse (vraiiiiiment). Par contre, je n'avais qu'un petit crouton de pain qui s'est terminé après 2 bouchés. Je trouvais ça dommage de terminer mon tartare à la fourchette. Le service a été très rapide malgré un groupe sur place. Mon conjoint a pris les bénédictines et c'était très bien aussi. Les patates déjeuner sont grandioses!  À essayer!

Came here for brunch - the eggs benny are to die for (although I'll ask them to go a bit heavier on the hollandaise next time).  Just delish!  My friends ordered the omelettes and frittatas - both delish also.  Can't go wrong!

Good food, great service, and a nice ambiance.  I came here with my dragon boat team and they were very kind to accommodate a party of 30+.  My favourite dish of the day was dessert, Goat cheesecake with mango compote. It's not very often you find goat cheese that is not gamy.

I am very disappointed after reading the other reviews. I ordered the French onion soup and it was very watered down and lacked flavor. We both had the tilapia dish with mussels, shrimp and chorizo. The mussels were mushy and the shrimp lacked were not very fresh. It's pretty inside but that's about it.  There are too many other places nearby that are far better.
Amazing service, wine, and food. I recommend the Duck - probably the best duck I have ever had. Cheers!

Daniel and I decide to go into the old city because we want something good, french, and tasty.  We planned nothing.  We park, we walked across to a hotel and asked for a recommendation and we got this place.  What  a wonderful little bistro.  Now I'm sure it's not the best place ever, but there was nothing I did not like.  I ordered the creamy vegetable soup and the salmon and holy cow my taste buds were happy.  Daniel order the gravlax (oy so Jewish) and the veggie couscous with anise sauce and he was doing a little dance at the table.  He had a very nice red wine and I had probably the best Tanqueray and Tonic ever.  For desert I nearly died - I had this mouse-like ganache cake thing that was so rich!  Daniel and the creme de la sucre - sugar creamed with maple I think - whatever it was so good, and came with a side of nuts that he loved - we had to order another to take home with us.  The bar are is huge and the service was wonderful.  They even knew how to speak English so I didn't seem like a total jackass.  I would so go back here.

Solid as I recall it to be. Both my fiance and I had the hangar steaks with shallots on sat evening. Simply Devine.  I could not ask more of a hangar steak. Service was professional, respectful and very knowledgeable. Highly recommend to any in search of a classic french bistro in montreal!

The location/ambiance: It's located somewhat between the financial district and the old port, so if you're there for sightseeing or business it's a decent choice for a nice meal out. The place is classy (lots of warm tones - brown, copper) without being too pretentious. It's not too cramped, but we were there on a Monday night so the crowd was sparse anyhow.  The food: I enjoyed the food for the most part, some dishes definitely were better than others and there were a few disappointments along the way. The warm potato salad with marinated octopus was out of this world. It was bursting with flavor and was more octopus than potato salad in the end. The goat cheese starter was also very nice, though quite rich. For entrees, we had the lobster ravioli and the fish & chips. The ravioli was fine, but nothing special. I didn't care for the presentation or the mass of onions in the dish. The fish was nicely done and melted in your mouth. Dessert was a brownie with chocolate ice cream and some sort of raspberry sauce. This was the worst part of the meal and it really lacked a deep chocolate flavor.   The service: This is where the whole experiences goes a bit awry. We're seated promptly by a stiff maitre d' and then wait for 20 minutes for anyone to come take a drink order or tell us about the specials. Finally the maitre d' comes over and says something off-putting like, "Looks like you're anxious to order" and takes our orders without telling us the specials. The food comes promptly and was true to the menu. We receive no other service until halfway through our entrees I finally flag down a waiter to order another drink. Apparently, he was our waiter but this was the first time he spoke to us, as he was busy flirting with other patrons. One of the drinks was delayed until our entrees were nearly completed. For dessert, he reeled off a long list instead of giving us a menu. Only during dessert were we ever asked how the food was. The waiter was jovial but he was not good at his job service wise.    This is hard to rate because the food was overall very good but the rest of the experience I would never want to re-live.  Average.

On our first night in Montreal, we opted to try Holder.  We were a little bit worried at first because we had a vegetarian with us.  Since we don't usually worry about what's on the menu, I had to ask if they had any options for vegetarians.  Luckily, they did!  We tried the duck confit and the fish.  Duck confit was cooked perfectly.  Fish was tender and flaky.  Service was friendly and attentive.  They kept our water and wine glasses filled.  Would def come back to try brunch next time!

It's a solid space in the old quarter of Montreal. Spot on with customer service. Whether you speak english or french.  It's truly a modern, but yet old world French feel. It has a typical look I've seen in many french themed restaurants.   We came here for brunch. I ordered a quiche made of spinach, gruyere and mushroom which came with a side salad. It was delicious and I craved more. Always a good sign when you want more.  Would I go here again? Maybe.  It's not that the food wasn't good or the space wasn't clean or modern. IT just lacked a joie de vie.  It felt a little sterile at times but it doesn't mean the space isn't welcoming. I certainly recommend it.

Fantastic ambiance and what I thought was some great, professional staff. However- food took a while to come out, and when it did, my order wasn't right. Rather than wait another hour for a correction, I was forced steal more bites of my boyfriend's picks. The duck confit was tasty!

Everyone enjoyed their meal more than I did, so this place is probably a 4/5...just not for me.  I came here specifically for duck confit and was gravely disappointed. I asked for it "extra crispy" (because I love tender duck meat covered in thin, crispy skin) but it wasn't crispy at all and, in fact, the underside of the skin was mostly unrendered fat. No thanks.  Having said that, everyone else enjoyed their food thoroughly:  Fois gras pate....wonderful Mussels....exceptional Fish and chips...."the best I've ever had" said Mitch Braised beef cheeks....truly excellent  I guess I just ordered wrong.  The large space is a nice, well-designed bistro but for me, lacked a bit of warmth and personality. Next time I would go around the corner to Barocco.

Excellent service! La nourriture me séduit chaque fois, je ne sais jamais quoi choisir tellement je veux tout! Délicieux, belle ambiance, toujours mon 1er choix!  À essayer:  Tartare saumon et tartare boeuf Joue de boeuf Pappardelles Tartelette de chèvre chaud Salade de pieuvre et grelots Huîtres 6 ou 12 Calmars Potage paysan Velouté d'asperges, crabe et jambon Canard confit Onglet de boeuf  Saumon grillé Tilapia Mi-cuit caramel fleur de sel Crème brûlée  Il y a toujours les midis de semaine 3 choix de menus du jour accompagnés d'une salade ou potage du jour ainsi qu'un choix de viande et de poisson du jour. Tous les soirs il y a aussi un choix de viande et poisson du jour.

I'm going to confess that I'm writing this review a bit late so I might be a bit hazy on my food. The atmosphere of Holder is incredibly classy but since it's located in the heart of downtown Montreal I expect nothing less. The first time I came in here it was spectacular, dragged in here by my friend's mother urging us to try the fried ravioli, a mixture of cheese blended with a bit of jalapeños. I am a huge jalapeno poppers fan so I couldn't stop reaching for more, despite the heaviness of the starter.   After, I decided to drag my friend back there so that we could get a better sense of the restaurant. We ordered my usual drink, a Jameson and ginger ale, then proceeded with the meal. At one point the waiter disappeared but for 9:00 pm at night it was relatively packed. I was craving seafood so I ordered a pan-seared tilapia in my pidgin French which came out relatively nicely. I'm not a big fan of tilapia as I often think it's a very cheap fish but this one was dressed nicely for the occasion. It was served on a bed of julienned carrots and other greens topped with almonds (I think, again forgive me my memory is hazy). Not bad, but not knock you off your feet amazing.   Overall, not a terrible dining experience, our waiter was a bit lack luster but hey he didn't ruin the meal. However this place is incredibly pricey and for the price I paid I expected much better quality food. But hey, you're on vacation splurge a little. It was a decent choice for the price but with no regrets now I leave the decision making up to you.

Came here to grab dinner on a Saturday night  Atmosphere: - French bistro trendy - Got a nice table by the street, indoors  Service:  - Lacking - waiter was inattentive and not friendly.  I'd say he was your typical Quebecois waiter - Specials were not offered up, had to ask him if there were any  Food: - For an app we got the Gravlax and yellow beet carpaccio, orange and dill vinaigrette.  This was ok. Nothing special - Lady got the Pappardelle with mushrooms, pine nuts and pancetta.  This was in a cream sauce.  It was not very good. It was not that warm (had been sitting in the kitchen too long) and it was more cream/oily that one would want - I got the Braised beef cheek which was edible and served over mashed potatoes and hericot vert.  The dish was not very warm (had been sitting in the kitchen too long), the wine they used to braise the meat was cheap and you could taste it in the sauce.  Overall, I wasn't that excited about this - We passed on desert  Other: - Prices are too high for the quality  - Didn't like the vibe of the place - Overall wish we didn't waste a night out here

A perfect brasserie!  Full and active on a rainy Sunday night. It's easy to walk past the entrance from the street.  You hang your coats and umbrellas the the cloakroom. The room is enormous yet so bustling it seems warm and inviting, but not too loud.   Around the columns are chalkboard menu specials  Chicken liver pate and beef tartare were excellent. The pate was served in a deep cup along with toasted bread.  One entree was calf's liver served with a generous helping of richly decadent mashed potatoes and a heap of caramelized onions.  The other was a Shepard's pie: perfect shredded lamb over superb mashed potatoes.    We ended with an Armagnac - a nice way to top off such a heavy meal. Holder offers a very good selection of reasonably priced digestives.  Service was excellent - the wine list offered a very good range of choices.  The menu offers may good choices. Bring a hearty appetite.

Had an amazing brunch this morning. My dish was very tasty and the bacon was nice and crispy, but not dry.  Now it's time to go and have a productive day. Service is very quick, very well located. Easy to find parking on the week-end or early morning.

Went for dinner on Fri night. I love that their kitchen is open late . Nice restaurant that you wanna dress up a little bit for. The salmon tartare as an app was very good.  The lobster ravioli was perfect... the most perfect ravioli I've ever eaten. BF had the shepherd's pie which was delicious! The food  presentation was aesthetically pleasing.  Topped it off with profiteroles for dessert. Our waiter was very nice and attentive helping us choose items on the menu. When we left the staff behind the bar wished us a good night. Def reccommend this place open late, great ambiance and decor, friendly service and most importantly great food.

Great food, nice restaurant  This is a place on our must-return list.  The restaurant is nice, not especially elegant, more like a bistro.  The service is quite good and the food is scrumptious.  the bavette de veau (veal) a la marsala had the best sauce on it since I first enjoyed it over 30 years ago at a small Montreal location.  Better than any I've had at many US restaurants in the intervening years.  My family reports that the duck confit was also excellent.  The desserts were beautifully presented and delicious, but I can't quite remember what we had.

I'm really not sure what I think of this place. On one hand, it's got nice decor, the food is reasonably good, and the service is fine. On the other hand, it feels a bit artificial, and for the prices, I'd expect a better experience.  On the food, it is supposed to be a french bistro and the food sort of reflects that. I had a salmon tartare, which was very good. But, the menu was littered with other options like fish and chips and pasta primavera. To me, that's a dead giveaway of a place that is going for a theme but wants to stay mainstreamed and broad. I think the other dishes people had, including the lamb and the fish and chips (I recognize the irony) were all fine. The desserts were obnoxiously large and were generally odd, gaudy takes on French dessert.  The service was fine. Nothing bad, nothing especially good. It was fine; I have almost no reaction at all.  The interior is both nice and revealing of the restaurant's underbelly. It has all the trappings of a classic French bistro, done in a modern, large space. But, the consequence is a feeling of almost corporate design. It's consistent with the menu, I think.

Appetizer and dinner were outstanding.  I had the cold Foie Gras, which was perfectly paired with a pear chutney and a wine that was recommended by my waiter (do not recall what hte wine was).  Then had the lobster ravioli with truffle cream sauce, fantastic.  Dessert was creme brulee which was pretty standard, nothing too exciting.  took a star off to the not-exceptional dessert and service at times was a bit lacking, but the waiter was quite busy.

Holder is a wonderful place with simply delicious food and great service. The space is a bit loud, but not unbearably so. The decor is a nice blend of old world style and sharp modern lines.  In giving the place five stars, I must admit that I had recently eaten meals featuring duck hearts, sea snails, and bone marrow, so I was ready for a hearty, more classic bistro meal.  First, I ordered the Country Seasonal Vegetable soup (around 8$). It was the best vegetable soup I have ever eaten at a restaurant- perfectly balanced flavour that was not too salty, spicy, or bland.  For my main course I had the steak and frites (around 21$). The steak was perfectly cooked and flavourful. The frites were blessedly not overcooked or oversalted.  Dessert featured several options. I chose a butterscotch dessert (around 9$) that had ice cream and an individually cooked cream filled butterscotch cake. It was pure deliciousness.  The service here was great. Food came in a timely manner, and my group never waited for water refills or plates to be cleared.   I would return to eat at Holder's tomorrow. It is great particularly for those looking for a straightforward French bistro meal.

This was hands down the BEST meal that my boyfriend and I have ever shared together. The ambiance is awesome and the staff could not be more gracious. We got there on a Wednesday night and the place was packed (always a good sign). When the host asked if we had a reservation, we said no. Then, we waited for that face that most snobby hosts/hostesses make (you know the face...) when they tell you that there is nothing they can do. To the contrary - the host smiled and asked us to step to the side - assuring us that he would find us a table. Within 3 minutes, we were seated. Our waiter (I believe his name is Martin?) was so kind and provided top notch service. Everything we ate was perfect - it melted on our mouths! I had the salmon tartare, lobster ravioli and the chocolate mousse. My boyfriend had the foie gras (cold), hanger steak and the Creme brûlée. If we lived here in Montreal, we would definitely come here on a regular basis. It was definitely the highlight of our trip!

You see that cover photo they have of steak tar tar?? That's my pic! Yay!   Love this place!!! The atmosphere is very French bistro. The service was excellent- they are there for you but not over bearing.  The food was fantastic. I had the steak tar tar (smaller portion) which was actually plenty. The steak was very fresh and the flavors all blendes together nicely. Came with toast as well. Pretty filling if you are not too hungry.  Then I had the beef cheeks. Braised. Over mashed potatoes. With a dark beautiful sauce. I really enjoyed my meal here and the prices were very fair.   There were also alot of locals here which is always a good feeling. Love this place!

Such a shame Yelp does not have Canadian presence yet... I'm sure the locals have lots to say about this gem amidst their city.  Knock. My. Socks. Off.  That is what Holders did to me.  I started with a roast vegetable gazpacho topped with goat cheese- heaven!  (Although my sister found it too similar to salsa)  Next up was lobster ravioli with a truffle oil sauce while my sister had her usual steak-frites.  A bottle of Brouilly and we walked out the door with a bill under $100!    How fantastic to be able to eat in such luxury without paying too much money!
Beau restaurant situé au centre - ville. L'intérieur est convial . Le service était rapide et efficace et la nourriture tant qu'à elle était savoureuse .

I enjoyed Holder during my recent trip to Montreal because a local colleague of mine recommended it. I found a very beautiful and spacious restaurant with friendly service, and a very upscale trendy atmosphere that is perfect for a romantic dinner or work event. The bar area also is large to accompany large groups.  The menu is traditional French with many variations. My colleague loved the salmon, and I chose the traditional hanger steak and frites. The fries were delicious, and the steak was A-Ok (not the best I've ever had honestly but good). The complimentary fresh French bread and butter was a wonderful way to start the meal. I chose coffee to end my meal, and it also was dark and tasty.  It's hard to compete in a city of so many great French restaurants, but this is certainly one that stands on its own two feet as a nice place to experience the city's cuisine if you're in the area.

We went for brunch and ordered the omelette of the day and the salmon tartare. The omelette (featured duck, mozzarella cheese, and mushrooms) was so-so but the salmon tartare was very good. I'd recommend that one.

i love this place. in the last few montreal visits, i've made an effort to return to this restaurant for a great dinner. staff are very polite, food is on-time, delicious and the menu changes. the restaurant facility is very cool, in old montreal with lots to do and see afterwards.
Best duck confit! Crispy outside and tender inside. Falls off the bone. Fingerling potatoes and arugula perfecto!!

A very pretty room in a cool looking building. Crowded but not noisy. Recommended by a local. We were not especially impressed. Everything was fine but nothing was very good. It was average food. We had hangar steaks and mussels and they were okay but I can do better myself with them any home. The broth was more salty than anything else and was missing that something that makes you want to drink it. Then broccoli rabe was bitter. Steaks were cooked correctly, frites were good, the service was very, very good. Our server was friendly, attentive, and professional. The place seems to be very popular but we did not love it.

Nothing impressive, it's nothing more than average. Their brunch had really small serving sizes and pushy service. Everything tastes just fine, I can't believe i was really looking forward to dine here

Me and my brother-in-law went there for occasional lunch not very busy early afternoon after we received our food and we're eating and in a conversation the busboy tried to reached across our food and our conversation to grab the sugar he asked my brother-in-law to stop eating and grabbing a sugar for him that was very rude and very unacceptable I've been here a few times I feel like the waiter is on methamphetamine. Don't know if this restaurant has a drug problem I'm leaning towards that.
Eaten a few times this year. Really enjoyed the liver. Good price ($25 - $35 pp) quick service and big variety. Enjoyed the scallops when they were the special of the day.

A nicer and somewhat larger place for French style fare without being too expensive. The decor is attractive and the space is large but not very noisy. Service is professional but friendly. The shrimp special was delicious as was the vege soup du jour. We also tried the octopus appetizer and the duck confit. It is on the edge of the old city so not touristy and well worth the walk.
Tres bien! Very enjoyable service and meal.

Had their Confit de canard, pommes de terre rattes roquette, vinaigrette truffée. Price is ok.  However, the duck very oily so the bed of arugula was completely soaked in oil. I think they could've patted off some of the oil before serving.   Ambiance is a bit noisy at night so it's great for groups maybe not if you're trying to have an intimate dinner.

Holder was picked after about an hour of reading reviews and looking up menus. The atmosphere was warm and inviting. We came on a Sunday night and it was slow. Our waiter was very friendly, and very handsome! We started off with the warm goat cheese appetizer, DELISH! I ordered the duck confit which came with an arugula salad and roasted potatoes. The duck was perfectly cooked and not too salty as duck confit often can be. I was slightly disappointed with the very small amount of potatoes, I think there were 3 half small potatoes on my plate. My friend ordered the lobster ravioli and enjoyed it.  With splitting the appetizer between the two checks and a glass of wine, my check ended up being about $40 before tip.
Had a tasty brunch here recently: recommend the poached eggs and truffles and also crepes and maple syrup dish. Le service est correct.

Walked in late on a Sunday night about a half an hour before they were closing and they seated us immediately and were not put off by the time at all which was really nice!  My bf and I both ordered beers that came out almost quicker than I thought was possible for our adorable waitress to go get.   My bf ordered the foie gras appetizer which was amazing and I had the french onion soup which was really good but not the best ever.  We split the duck confit as our entre.  It was AMAZING, perfectly cooked and extremely delicious.  I'd go back just for this dish.  We stayed past closing and they were still seating.  It was really nice to see that they didn't turn anyone away.  Loved this place.  Definitely recommend.

Great Food, great ambience, warm staff. Anything in the menu except the liver is bomb. Ive had the duck which was incredibly succulent, hanger steak is a bit small but makes up in quality. Creme brulee is simply phenomenal

Came here for dinner! Had the salmon tartar which was really good, and we ordered the lobster ravioli and the braised beef cheek. Both were great, although the ravioli isn't filling. Make sure to get a reservation since the place was absolutely filled, and its location is a little walk away from old port. Definitely wanna come back for brunch!

Six of us came here for a dinner and it was pretty lively and a good dinner crowd for a Monday evening. The restaurant is on the western edge of old Montreal on McGill just  1/2 block north of St Paul Oest street. It is inside a large stone-faced building in suite 100.   It is like a downtown restaurant in many cities, filled with some businessmen in suits, but on this evening there was a lot of tables full of 30 somethings enjoying group dinners. Our server was a smiling and efficient woman who made our meal well paced with wine (decent selection but not stuffy in range), appetizers (about $10), mains (averaging about $20 - $25) and desserts (roughly $8 average).   For appetizer I had a chilled salmon gravelax, very good! Others had the fisherman's soup, small salads, salmon tartar, beef tartar and gazpacho. For mains we had Hangar Steaks with Frites, special Halibut in a cream sauce topped with veggies, and I had the Duck Confit on a bed of greens with country potatoes. We enjoyed a couple of bottles of Ortas 2009 Rasteau Rhone. Desserts included a lemon mascarponi, creme brûlée, and a chocolate cremieux with coffee ice cream and sauce.   Everyone enjoyed their dinner at our table, and it seems everyone else in the restaurant were smiling and enjoying good food, wine and friends.

We came here for Saturday and Sunday brunch! The food was great, really liked eggs Benedict with salmon! The omelet was great as well! Service was fast and the host was very welcoming! Overall very good experience!
Went there for lunch on a Sunday and they only had a brunch menu with some options for lunch. It's good in general given the prices. It's big and calm so easy to find places.

My friends and I came here late night about 9pm just for apps and desserts. We weren't hungry, but thought we should have something. We ordered the beef tartare and fried calamari. The tartare was typical, but there was some gaminess to it that came back to haunt me in the middle of the night. It was served with crostini, but I liked it better with baguette  which you need to request. I also spread a little butter on each bite to give it more richness and stave off the gaminess. My friends liked the calamari which was lightly-battered and perfectly cooked. Portion was small for the price. These are rings from large squids not the tiny ones, so no legs if you're into that like me . Desserts were priced reasonably and tasted amazing. One friend had the vanilla Creme Brûlée, I convinced another to have the Profiteroles (small puffs filled with vanilla ice cream in a pool of chocolate sauce), and I had the Butterscotch Mi-Cuit which was a butterscotch soufflé served with butterscotch ice cream and caramel with an almond cookie. We would return just for the desserts.

I came to Holder with a group of 10 for a late lunch one afternoon, per the suggestion of my hotel.   I ordered the Lobster Ravioli ($24) and my friends ordered the Duck, the Lamb Shepard Pie, the Tilapia, the Fish and Chips, and Steak. I enjoyed the lobster ravioli but it was not the most filling of the meals for its high price tag. My friend however said that the Duck was really good.   The prices were higher than other restaurants in the area and the waitress blatantly stared over our shoulder as we left the tip on the handheld payment machine.   Overall, Holder was a decent restaurant for lunch with higher than deserved prices.

I went to this restaurant last night, the second time in a year.  I must say this is an absolutely delightful restaurant. It is a fancy place, but where you won't feel burdened by form or rigidity.  Both times I have come I have absolutely enjoyed their beef tartar. It is quite outstanding actually. I suggest you get it very spicy! It goes just perfectly with the crisp bread crackers they bring!  They also serve delicious oysters and have a nice selection of both appetizers as well as main courses.   Last year I had their flank steak, which was very good, but this year I opted for one of the night's specials, a ribeye steak with truffle and rustic potato mash.  Absolutely delicious! The people I was with had a delicious looking dessert, however I settled for a glass of Chivas Regal!  Try the beef tartar spicy!
We are sitting here for almost 2 hours with no food!  i guess something is amiss in the kitchen.  I would not recommend this restaurant currently.  good luck!

Had a lovely meal here!   Seemed slightly better priced compared to other similar brunches in the area. Very friendly service who refilled my water glass 1 million times (it was a warm day). Quiet at the time we went, on a Sunday afternoon - a very relaxing environment.   We ordered two savory dishes - a spinach salad with smoked salmon on it, and fish & chips, plus fruity crepes. The salad was so good and filling (surprising, for a salad) that I barely got to the rest, but suffice to say that everything was tasty.   I also had the cheapest wine on the menu, a pinot grigio, and it was really delicious!

Recommended by the concierge at the Marriott Chateau (which is lovely, and 4 stars).   Holders was lovely, warm and inviting. Staff was as well. Friend and I stopped for lunch, and were lucky to get there just before the lunch rush. Service was prompt, courteous and efficient without being overbearing. Menu was interesting and very varied.   My friend had the Braised beef cheek, which he liked very much, and I had the seafood soup and the warm octopus and new potato salad. Octopus is a favorite of mine, but you take your chances, as it can be very rubbery if cooked poorly. Luckily, the chef at Holders knew EXACTLY how to cook it, and it was wonderful. The contrast of the octopus and the potatoes, highlighted by the sauce was delectable.   Will definitely go again when in Montreal.
Came here at the recommendation of my hotel and was very very pleased. Great soup and one of the best duck confit dishes I've had.

As Lisa N points out, the Foie Gras with gingerbread was executed well.  Unfortunately, any sous chef should be able to execute this dish and the pairing is practically a standard.    The warm potato and octopus salad was meh.  Tender octopus was muted by an ocean of mustard sauce.  The meal went downhill from there.  For main courses we ordered the Lobster ravioli and the Roasted Scallops.  The ravioli were edible though they tasted as though they were purchased from a distributor rather than made fresh.  The scallops were a complete disaster.  Listed on the menu as " Roasted scallops, saffron sauce, leek "confits", spinach" they were served wrapped in bacon.  While that's not a crime in and of itself, it is problematic when patrons may not eat pork products and that is not listed on the menu.  We're not helpless or zealots - so we cut the bacon off and began to eat but the scallops were cooked past well done and rubbery.  We left the plate practically untouched.  For dessert we ordered the fruit salad with sherbert and the runny butterscotch cake in order to hedge our bets and I'm glad we did.  The cake was fine if not good but the fruit salad was a disgrace to chefs everywhere.  A plate of day old cut fruit replete with the juice that had leaked out of them as they died a slow death.  The plating was that of a school cafeteria - slopped on the plate.  If one eats with their eyes first, my eyes were disgusted.  I would not recommend this place, nor trust the opinions of those who do.

Really loved this restaurant, as the perfect french bistro. We had a french onion soup, and seared foie gras, gingerbread, red wine reduction, and dried fruit for appetizers. For entrees, we did the salmon tartare (as a main), and the lamb shepherd's pie. All dishes were delicious, with the foie gras and the salmon tartare outstanding. The restaurant was roomy and had a lively vibe. Would definitely come again.

Fun bistro with great food.   Great service. The place is dim without being overly dark, casual but festive.   The menu had so many delicious looking choices that if we lived in Montreal we would have to come back to try more! Here's the run down of what we ordered:  Buffala mozzarella salad: YES. A wonderful twist on a caprese. The arugula is in the most wonderful balsamic, the cheese is soft and salty, the proscuitto is prosciutto.   Vegetable soup: spectacular. Similar to minestrone and just fantastically flavored.  Salmon tartare: really good. The yogurt is a nice compliment. It's a lot so I would recommend getting the appetizer portion.  Salmon: didn't try but my mother really enjoyed   Warm goat cheese: good, but the only thing that didn't amaze us. Pretty simple goat cheese without too much flavor. Would skip this next time.   Hope you enjoy this as much as we did!
Very solid food, great lively atmosphere and elegant decor... the hotel told us it's an excellent representative of French cooking - as advertised!

Portions are big, but overall the food is uninspired. It's decent, but not for the discerning.  Also the noise level is very high. Totally uninspired wine selection by the sommelier, it was clearly a choice that was intended to be easily drinkable rather than a nuanced bottle.

This place is outstanding. The foie gras on gingerbread was phenomenal, the atmosphere delightful. I must also say that the service was what really makes this place special. We were a large group and they really did a fantastic job - getting our table organized before we arrived (we called ahead), being patient during the ordering process as everyone consulted over wines and appetizers, food coming out all together and being delivered to the correct person with confidence, and automatically splitting everyone's bill (remembering who split wine with whom, etc). I was hugely impressed.

Had breakfast here, was delighted by the food although the portions were really small. We were a rather large group and our waiter seemed somewhat annoyed and impatient. He could've handled that better, instead, service was slow and unthorough.

Great place! Big place with lots of tables and a French brasserie aesthetic. Everyone's food was delicious and the service was excellent. Delicious goat cheese appetizer, salmon with lemon-beurre blanc potato puree (I could have eaten 10 potatoes' worth of that stuff!), and desserts. The food was even on par with food we ate on our last visit to Paris, which I don't say lightly! A little loud and crowded on a Saturday night, but this was the only place in the area that had room for 4 last-minute--we appreciated that they were willing to accommodate us! Would highly recommend this place for a nice dinner out.

This place looks very nice. But far from cozy and ambient atmosphere... more like a place you take your sorority party to eat and drunk.  Loud. My grilled tilapia was nothing but salt. Placed on top of rice which I hardly tasted underneath all the spices.  Thank god the service is great, so water was refilled at all times!  Would I come back??? I didn't hate the place, but unlikely.

The decor and ambiance of the restaurant was lovely. The place felt nice and cozy. But we were not impressed with the service. We came here at 5pm on a Monday after seeing all the great reviews. But our experience was not acceptable for a restaurant of this caliber.   Service was horrible. When we first arrived, there was no hostess or anyone available to seat us. There was coat check but no one offered to take our coats. Once seated we did not get any water until we called the hostess to call the server over for us to order. The server was never around to provide us any service. We asked a few questions regarding the menu but the server wasn't really informative or helpful.   When the food arrived they just place it on the table with out explaining the dish. I'm not sure if that was normal but all the restaurants I go to in this range usually explain the dish and what's inside.   The server also never excused himself when he reach over us or come by with utensils and plates. I felt that this was really impolite. Even when he was clearing the table, he held the plates with a bunch of knives right in front of my boyfriends face at eye level.   As for pay. The bill was tossed on the table. The credit card machine was firmly left on the table too even though the server knew that we were ready to pay. The server never handed anything to us nicely.   Not sure why he was so rude but it's really unprofessional. The food was okay but the service ruined our mood.   We ordered the foie gras, it was nicely seared. The sauce that came with it complimented the foie gras well. But the gingerbread wasn't our thing.   The Duck Confit was crispy in the outside (skin) and pretty soft on the inside (meats). The meat fell off the bone easily. The flavour was okay but it was a bit dry. It came on a salad with potatoes.   The beef cheek was really soft. Flavour was okay but it was really salty. It came with some green beans.   Overall, the restaurant was nice, food was decent. Nothing exceptional. Service was horrible.

Pretty good place.  I would probably give it 3.5 stars if I could.  Busy atmosphere.   I had the salmon tartare with french fries and was pleased with the meal, but not blown away.  Not overly expensive, but I would not consider this place to be a good deal.

We popped in on a rainy night and were able to find a table. It appears they seat their customers by language-- French in one section, English in another. No big deal- just an observation. The food is good and is served quickly. The grilled vegetable couscous with merguez is delicious! Holder is very generous with the amount of merguez they serve. mmmmm!

Modern French Cuisine. Recommended by the hotel concierge. Great atmosphere with upscale clientele from surrounding business district. Lunch menu includes a fixe option including a salad/soup or main. Items served with fries offer substitute of any side. Pricing is appropriate for upscale dining. Medium crowd at lunch. Weekends offer brunch as well.

Came here last Friday night around 8pm with a group of 10.  Hopping with people and a great atmosphere.  Not the place to go for a quiet dinner as it was quiet noisy but maybe that was our group making all the noise!  Food was good although I found it pricey for what I got.  I had the Lamb special which was great but not good enough for $30.  Service was surprisingly attentive given how busy they were.  We were settling in for a 20-30 minute wait at the bar (yes, we showed up w/o a reservation) when our table came up after only a 5 minute wait!  Tried my friends Talapia and it was quite nice and more reasonably priced that the Lamb special.  Steaks were reportedly good as well.  I will definitely return next time I am in town.

Service was good.  However, the food was just okay. We went here on late Saturday afternoon and they only have lunch/brunch menu.  I ordered Veal Steak Frites, it was just okay. Sauce was okay, no flavor and under seasoned.  They do have good ambiance and decor.  I would only go here if there is no other place to go or when you are in a pinch and extremely hungry.

Spectacular restaurant. Spectacular service. And most of all, spectacular food. Beef tartare is one of the best we've had there. And the braised beef cheek was mouth watering and tender. Literally did not even have to chew it. Just melted in your mouth. Reservations were not necessary but I would recommend it.
Very good food at reasonable price. Had the braised beef cheek - full of flavor and melted in mouth. Mussels cooked to perfection. Waiter was incredibly sweet. Highly recommend!

'Such a busy place with good old-Montreal ambiance! It was a little loud inside, so not the best option for intimate conversations. However, if you're there for the food, then this is a lovely option.  I had the duck confit and it was delicious. I would definitely return again.

Really tasty place with warm ambiance.  My family got the French onion soup, pasta, duck and salmon.  All of us were very pleased with our choices.  We ended the meal with a pineapple turnover which was fantastic.

I'm surprised this place gets 4-5 stars. In my opinion, it is ok. There are much better places in Montreal.   Sundays are tough to find a place open in Old Montreal. We ate at Holder because it was walking distance from our hotel and other places were full or closed.  The restaurant decor is nice. It was certainly busy. It is supposed to be a traditional French restaurant. Um, not so sure about that. Very Americanized in my opinion.  My first complaint was our food came out way too fast. This tells me everything is pre cooked before you even order, then heated up.  My husband had the vegetable soup, which came out cold.  I started with the French Onion soup. It was too sweet and did not have enough onion taste.  We went with the special, which was cod. This was a nice dish. The fish was perfectly cooked with a wonderful finish. It was served on a bed of Israeli cous cous, which complemented it nicely.   If you are looking for a great French restaurant, this is not it. Not awful, but nothing to write home about.

Just happen to walk by this evening; the menu looked interesting, as did the crowd inside. A typically busy restaurant, there were no open tables, so we elected to sit at the bar. That decision made all the difference for us as bar-man Julian was the perfect host, bartender and waiter.  Food was very good, Mixed Greens, Fresh Oysters, Vegetable Soup, were excellent starters. Strip Steak and Duck Confit were wonderful Entrees. The Butterscotch Mi-Cuit was an amazing finish, Très bien Holder.

Excellent food and courteous service. Had the onion soup starter which was tasty. Not the best I've had but good. The mozzarella pesto salad was very good - served with prosciutto and sweet figs and pine nuts. The big finish was a very solid creek brûlée. My companion had a melt in your mouth beef cheek entree that was extremely well prepared. No complaints and I left very satisfied.

Trip advisor was definitely right about this place. I loved the fact that it is placed in Old Montreal and we came on a thursday night , it was packed yet the waiters found us a table right away. We ordered the frise salad which was great for an appetizer. We followed with mussels and lobster ravioli as entrees. The food literally melts in your mouth to how good and fresh it is. The staff is very attentive , place is great and the food is delciious - what can more can you want ? Will be back again for sure !

It was my second time to visit here and I always order the duck confit as recommended by many and it never fails me every time. It was done by perfection, it was crispy, greasy and together with arugula and potatoes on the side makes it an exceptional meal. I will aways make sure to visit here every time I'm in town.

We came for dinner before fireworks and everything was phenomenal, I had the gazpacho and the lobster ravioli and while it didn't look like much in the plate ... The serving amount was perfect. You finish your plate but don't leave hungry. The lemon cream dessert was amazing , my boyfriend had the chocolate mousse and also loved it. In terms of quality vs price , the prices are definitely fair

We arrived at 8:25 for our 8:30 reservation and sat at the bar for a few minutes. The restaurant is spacious but crowded. We had a table for five and started with two salads and two appetizers: the calamari, the goat cheese on puff pastry, salad with pear and blue de benedictin and frisée with lardons all delicious. Then our table ordered the French onion soup, the country soup, moules frites meunière et anise avec creme and the special veal chop. All cooked perfectly and served with aplomb. We ordered three desserts: truffles, profiteroles and a chocolate ganache. The sever recommended an excellent Chilean wine for our meal.  All in all a very good meal
Eaten here twice on this trip, this time lunch. Both meals where great as was the service

Wife had fritata I had french toast with apples and syrup. Wow wow wow. Awesomely good. Service was great an attentive, despite my american idiocy of not understanding english in a french accent.....chedaaaaaa meant cheddar and the rest i didnt understand either, but was irrelevant because my taste buds comprends just fine.

I ordered moules frites (mussels and fries), but unfortunately they were out, so I got the lobster ravioli. It tasted fine, but a forgettable dish. I had the creme brulee for dessert. Also tasted nice, but forgettable.   My dining companions really liked their dishes. I snagged a few fries from a friend and the fries were indeed very crispy, tender, and delicious. *sigh* It just made me wish I could have had my moules frites.   The restaurant has a lovely old-fashioned moneyed old boys' club feel. I think it's all the big heavy food and impressively large bar. The service was pretty good overall, especially considering how large our party was.

I came to Montreal with zero experience and quickly found myself lost. I stumbled into what I thought was a bar but enjoyed the BEST French toast and a ridiculous wait staff. They were knowledgeable and friendly. The Bartenders Domenic and Chris are amazing!!! Enjoy

Update: I received a message from the owner with a very genuine apology and an offer I may take up which is to contact him so he can arrange an evening that I could enjoy. He also will be looking into who the server was which is appreciated.   I was very excited to come and try this place. I've heard lots of good things. This is why my first and last experience here was such a massive disappointment.   Prior to coming I took and look at the menu online and made my dinner choice, we were 8 adults and 4 kids. I was informed upon  entering the restaurant that there was a child's menu which I was happy about.   We were seated and then handed a set menu because we were more than 10 people. I explained to the hostess that the kids were ordering from a set menu and asked if I could get the full menu. He refused even though the rest of the party was fine and was placing orders based on their set menu. I ordered a coffee.   My husband ordered the flank steak, it came raw. We asked that it be cooked, when it came back it went from a 7oz portion to a 3 oz portion, now Im not a pro chef but I do cook and there is never that much shrinkage. When the waiter was asked he simply said it was always that size.   The rest of the party didn't rave about the food either, maybe it's all the hype that we expected something out of this world.   To make it worst, we asked another waiter to bring us napkins and he let us know he wasn't the waiter but he would get it anyway. When our waiter was at our table he proceeded to tell or waiter to take care of us cause we're pains in the ass and are constantly asking him for things.   Super unprofessional. We won't be back.

This was our first dinner in Montreal and it was great! It has a very bistro-like atmosphere and reminded us of La Coupole in Paris or Balthazar in NYC.  There were lots of locals, rather than tourists, there.  I had steak frites, which was really good, and my husband had fish and chips.  The wait staff was good and spoke both French and English. It wasn't particularly cheap but we didn't expect it to be. I certainly would have gone back if we'd had another night during our too-brief vacation.

A neat spot and a menu that makes it hard to choice just one entree! The host was a lovely addition to attentive service, delivering our wine himself. We went early (6:30p) on a Sunday and were sat right away, one of only a few tables. But they sat tables continuously after ours, filling up by the time left around 8:30. Faves were the duck confit, chevre chaud and chocolat cremeux! Lobster ravioli was excellent, too (not overbearing).
Magnifique!  Salmon tartare was my favorite in the city.  Duck confit was also delicious.  Lovely space, comfortable saloon-like (wood and brass) room.  Excellent friendly service.
The best meal we had in Montreal. The beef cheek was amazing.

Just order what your server recommends.  I had the warm goat cheese on a crispy cracker with olive tapanade for an appetizer and the butterscotch/ caramel dessert and they were out of this world.  I insisted on the lobster ravioli which was fine but not in the same planetary orbit as the others.    Service was about the best ever...it was the Fourth of July and the waiter brought my dessert with a sparkler on it...all the waiters came by to wish me happy birthday!  I know some people consider it "noisy" but it's such a happy noise.  It's the sound of  people having a wonderful time over wonderful food.  It made me absurdly happy just to sit there and observe all the little scenes playing out around me.  And then they fed me too!  I just floated back to Le Petit Hotel.

I tried it last August (2015), and it was that great that I had it again, as my last dinner in Montreal!! From the outside, it looks like a business building, but inside it has a nice ambiance, without too much decor.   The servers were friendly and got what we wanted in a timely manner.   Happy:  The menu is mostly French inspired and selective. If you go to the washroom, you can see the open kitchen. I ordered the duck confit with potatoes and a bed of arugula salad which is a nice touch with all the meat I'll be eating. The duck meat was tender and came off the bone which I like. The portion was enough for dinner and leaving some room for dessert.  For dessert, we shared a lemon cream with mascarpone cheese and coconut sorbet. Our second time!!   Not happy: None that I can think of. Even the washroom is clean and bright. A bonus!   Verdict:  Been here twice since I am not from Montreal. So it means - I'll be back in the future!!

Excellent Sunday Brunch.  Good friendly service.  We had a reservation.  I'd suggest that.  I had eggs.  Bacon. Yummy potatoes.  Included a small smoothie and bagel.  I like my bagel with a little more crunch ( warmer ). But was still good.  Everyone else enjoyed too.  A definite yes.
Great environment and the bestest thing was the dessert. We went twice to have there profiteroles they are amazing.

Beautiful restaurant in an equally beautiful building.   Came with 3 coworkers on a Weds. night around 7 and was glad to have a reservation - the place was pretty crowded.  We all started off with some Canadian beer and decided to skip appetizers. 3 of us ordered the T-bone & pommefrites, another ordered tilapia.   No sooner had I sipped my beer, my entree was set down in front of me. A little too quick, I felt like there was no time to relax.  T-bone was so-so....cut very thin. Since I asked for mine rare, it was barely cooked (obviously) and not hot, the butter they put on top wouldn't really melt.  Pommefrites were also nothing special...flavor was there but they were more soggy than crispy.  Overall, fun/nice atmosphere with mediocre food; I think you can do better.

Excellent service and excellent food even at the end of the day. They serve food and drinks right up until closing which is very convenient. The steak tartare was excellent and the pappardelle was very rich and tasty ( a little too decadent but very good). I ended the night with the lemon cream and mascarpone mousse, which was the highlight for me. This was one of the best desserts I've had. Have it with a side of honey and tea.

Yummy French food! I got the duck confit and it was amaaaaaazing. The combination of duck/arugula salad/ and some potato bites was just unbelievable. The skin of the duck is so crispy and the meat is very tender. My bf ordered the beef cheek (I forgot the name) but literally the meat melts in your mouth... you won't regret it.   One thing that I didn't enjoy was the French onion soup. Perhaps I like salty food but the dish was just too light for me... But I am giving this place a five because everything else trumps the soup.   Treat yourself :)

Once again great restaurant . I had their Braised beef cheek again. Very tender, flavorful , sitting in excellent savory mash and French string beans. Very good choc mousse - could be less sweet . Great service.

Probably the best French food I had so far. And oh dear, your service is well mannered and everyone is professional to do their jobs well! Thank you  Location: I think they are located in old town in Montreal. We were just walking and walking and my dad saw many people inside this place and asked if we could go there. Well, of course! We headed into the place and they had a full bar on the right hand side and they served lunch and brunch at the time when we got in.   Food: I had duck confit like always and my parents and Calf 's liver. Both are delicious as hell. My duck confit is crispy outside but inside is warm and tendered. The only bad part is that it 's bit salty to me. But the saltines is quickly balanced with veggies and potatoes on the side. I did not try my parents' liver but they told me that it's delicious. Oh, and we had their soup, potato soup for the day. Very balanced and smoothly, I wish I could had another stomach to finish another soup.  Service: Thank you for the good serve. As you know, I aint French speaking person. English is my second language and that's about it. I have no experience of speaking French at all so when I stepped into this place, I was little nervous. But the lady was bilingual and speak English well to treat us to a seat with window. In addition, when my parents got their soups faster than me, they came here and asked if anything went wrong and correct their delays for my soup. I was very moved because such thing has never happened back in USA. Thanks for the service!  Overall: although less famous than other places, holder is a place to try some traditional and legit French good with some caring service.  5 stars for sure.

Endive salad w blue cheese outstanding.  I like that they have demi-bottles of wine. Whole bottle can be too much for a couple sometimes.  Entrecôte de beouf was good.  Vegetarian dining partner was informed the papparadelli pasta could not be made vegetarian. Spaghetti with ricotta seemed very heavy. Waiter  assured us he veg couscous would be flavorful. When we were served, he failed to inform us the veg broth brought was on the side. We didn't know what it was. He should've told us it was supposed to be poured (the whole thing) into the couscous.  They need to have some more flavorful interesting vegetarian options.  Butterscotch mi-cuit is divine.  Service was prompt. Place is busy.

Toujours un bon choix pour le lunch, même pour le soir ou le 5@7.  La bavette de veau est vraiment très bonne. Le service super attentionné, l'ambiance assez dynamique, peut-être un peu bruyant, mais l'expérience est très agréable et positive. Choix de vin correct peut-être un peu limité au verre, mais raisonnable.  J'aime beaucoup cet endroit.

The food at Holder was definitely above par. I really enjoyed my beef cheek bourguignon and my friends enjoyed their tartare and steak. The atmosphere was exactly the type we were looking for, a relatively louder bistro.  Service was great and extremely helpful although it was very busy.

Beautiful space, and fantastic food to boot. What's fun is to enjoy the lively atmosphere, then take a step outside and realize how well the place is soundproofed - the joie de vive inside is simply bottled up.  A very relaxed pace to service - it doesn't feel neglectful in any way, rather, the tempo allows you to relax and fully enjoy your meal.  The moule frites are simply amazing- frites seemed to be double fried (as they should), and the patsis broth was an awesome accompaniment for the mussels.  There must have been 5 or 6 dozen mussels presented in a giant bowl, with at least three smaller bowls to accommodate the empty shells.   Top notch all around...

Belle ambiance, tres bon service, bonne bouffe. Juste pourquoi garder quelques vielles chaises pas tres confo ici et là. Demandez une banquette si le confort est plus important pour vous que de vous s'asseoir sur le oldy deco ;)
Decent place for lunch.  Lively environment. Friendly, professional staff.
Excellent!!! Came here for dinner on New Year's Eve, and had the beef cheek. Food was excellent, and service quite attentive, for such a busy night.

Holder was recommended to me by my hotel as a great French restaurant. The restaurant has the perfect lighting and vibe for a first or second date. Unfortunately, I was traveling on business, but enjoyed myself over by the bar area. I gnashed on the lovely selection of toasted breads and salted butter they brought out while I drank a local red ale. I asked the server for his recommendations and decided upon the braised beef cheek à la bourguignonne, which is braised for six hours. The meat literally just fell apart in my mouth it was so tender. The dish was also perfectly sized so that I was full but not overly so. Thanks for a lovely evening!

Great service for brunch and even better crepes. Plus, my cappuccino had to have been one of the best I've had in Montreal. Would highly recommend this restaurant for a Saturday brunch. And it's not overpriced either !

I've been here for both brunch and dinner and I absolutely love it. The food is great on all fronts, and has refined tastes that really communicates authenticity in French cuisine. The service is similarly professional and very courteous. I've always been a fan of high service standards in the boulangerie-type restaurant, and Holder really delivers. On top of that, the atmosphere is so great. Both morning and evening have a great view outside with large windows, and the interior is wonderfully designed in a classic bistro fashion that reminds me of the famous NYC restaurant Balthazar. The price is not low by any means but neither is it high for the quality of the experience here. Highly recommend this restaurant. P.S. also a great wine selection.
